98  /**
99   * Manages and performs region assignment.
100  * <p>
101  * Monitors ZooKeeper for events related to regions in transition.
102  * <p>
103  * Handles existing regions in transition during master failover.
104  */
105 @InterfaceAudience.Private
106 public class AssignmentManager extends ZooKeeperListener {
107   private static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(AssignmentManager.class);

242   /**
243    * Constructs a new assignment manager.
244    *
245    * @param server
246    * @param serverManager
247    * @param catalogTracker
248    * @param service
249    * @throws KeeperException
250    * @throws IOException
251    */
252   public AssignmentManager(Server server, ServerManager serverManager,
253       CatalogTracker catalogTracker, final LoadBalancer balancer,
254       final ExecutorService service, MetricsMaster metricsMaster,
255       final TableLockManager tableLockManager) throws KeeperException, IOException {
256     super(server.getZooKeeper());
257     this.server = server;
258     this.serverManager = serverManager;
259     this.catalogTracker = catalogTracker;
260     this.executorService = service;
261     this.regionsToReopen = Collections.synchronizedMap
262                            (new HashMap<String, HRegionInfo> ());
263     Configuration conf = server.getConfiguration();
264     // Only read favored nodes if using the favored nodes load balancer.
265     this.shouldAssignRegionsWithFavoredNodes = conf.getClass(
266            HConstants.HBASE_MASTER_LOADBALANCER_CLASS, Object.class).equals(
267            FavoredNodeLoadBalancer.class);
268     this.tomActivated = conf.getBoolean(
269       ASSIGNMENT_TIMEOUT_MANAGEMENT, DEFAULT_ASSIGNMENT_TIMEOUT_MANAGEMENT);
270     if (tomActivated){
271       this.serversInUpdatingTimer =  new ConcurrentSkipListSet<ServerName>();
272       this.timeoutMonitor = new TimeoutMonitor(
273         conf.getInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.period", 30000),
274         server, serverManager,
275         conf.getInt(ASSIGNMENT_TIMEOUT, DEFAULT_ASSIGNMENT_TIMEOUT_DEFAULT));
276       this.timerUpdater = new TimerUpdater(conf.getInt(
277         "hbase.master.assignment.timerupdater.period", 10000), server);
278       Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning(timerUpdater.getThread(),
279         server.getServerName() + ".timerUpdater");
280     } else {
281       this.serversInUpdatingTimer =  null;
282       this.timeoutMonitor = null;
283       this.timerUpdater = null;
284     }
285     this.zkTable = new ZKTable(this.watcher);
286     // This is the max attempts, not retries, so it should be at least 1.
287     this.maximumAttempts = Math.max(1,
288       this.server.getConfiguration().getInt("hbase.assignment.maximum.attempts", 10));
289     this.sleepTimeBeforeRetryingMetaAssignment = this.server.getConfiguration().getLong(
290         "hbase.meta.assignment.retry.sleeptime", 1000l);
291     this.balancer = balancer;
292     int maxThreads = conf.getInt("hbase.assignment.threads.max", 30);
293     this.threadPoolExecutorService = Threads.getBoundedCachedThreadPool(
294       maxThreads, 60L, TimeUnit.SECONDS, Threads.newDaemonThreadFactory("AM."));
295     this.regionStates = new RegionStates(server, serverManager);
296 
297     this.bulkAssignWaitTillAllAssigned =
298       conf.getBoolean("hbase.bulk.assignment.waittillallassigned", false);
299     this.bulkAssignThresholdRegions = conf.getInt("hbase.bulk.assignment.threshold.regions", 7);
300     this.bulkAssignThresholdServers = conf.getInt("hbase.bulk.assignment.threshold.servers", 3);
301 
302     int workers = conf.getInt("hbase.assignment.zkevent.workers", 20);
303     ThreadFactory threadFactory = Threads.newDaemonThreadFactory("AM.ZK.Worker");
304     zkEventWorkers = Threads.getBoundedCachedThreadPool(workers, 60L,
305             TimeUnit.SECONDS, threadFactory);
306     this.tableLockManager = tableLockManager;
307 
308     this.metricsAssignmentManager = new MetricsAssignmentManager();
309   }
310 
311   void startTimeOutMonitor() {
312     if (tomActivated) {
313       Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning(timeoutMonitor.getThread(), server.getServerName()
314           + ".timeoutMonitor");
315     }
316   }

361   /**
362    * Set the list of regions that will be reopened
363    * because of an update in table schema
364    *
365    * @param regions
366    *          list of regions that should be tracked for reopen
367    */
368   public void setRegionsToReopen(List <HRegionInfo> regions) {
369     for(HRegionInfo hri : regions) {
370       regionsToReopen.put(hri.getEncodedName(), hri);
371     }
372   }
373 
374   /**
375    * Used by the client to identify if all regions have the schema updates
376    *
377    * @param tableName
378    * @return Pair indicating the status of the alter command
379    * @throws IOException
380    */
381   public Pair<Integer, Integer> getReopenStatus(TableName tableName)
382       throws IOException {
383     List <HRegionInfo> hris =
384       MetaReader.getTableRegions(this.server.getCatalogTracker(), tableName, true);
385     Integer pending = 0;
386     for (HRegionInfo hri : hris) {
387       String name = hri.getEncodedName();
388       // no lock concurrent access ok: sequential consistency respected.
389       if (regionsToReopen.containsKey(name)
390           || regionStates.isRegionInTransition(name)) {
391         pending++;
392       }
393     }
394     return new Pair<Integer, Integer>(pending, hris.size());
395   }

423   /**
424    * Called on startup.
425    * Figures whether a fresh cluster start of we are joining extant running cluster.
426    * @throws IOException
427    * @throws KeeperException
428    * @throws InterruptedException
429    */
430   void joinCluster() throws IOException,
431       KeeperException, InterruptedException {
432     // Concurrency note: In the below the accesses on regionsInTransition are
433     // outside of a synchronization block where usually all accesses to RIT are
434     // synchronized.  The presumption is that in this case it is safe since this
435     // method is being played by a single thread on startup.
436 
437     // TODO: Regions that have a null location and are not in regionsInTransitions
438     // need to be handled.
439 
440     // Scan hbase:meta to build list of existing regions, servers, and assignment
441     // Returns servers who have not checked in (assumed dead) and their regions
442     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> deadServers = rebuildUserRegions();
443 
444     // This method will assign all user regions if a clean server startup or
445     // it will reconstruct master state and cleanup any leftovers from
446     // previous master process.
447     processDeadServersAndRegionsInTransition(deadServers);
448 
449     recoverTableInDisablingState();
450     recoverTableInEnablingState();
451   }
452 
453   /**
454    * Process all regions that are in transition in zookeeper and also
455    * processes the list of dead servers by scanning the META.
456    * Used by master joining an cluster.  If we figure this is a clean cluster
457    * startup, will assign all user regions.
458    * @param deadServers
459    *          Map of dead servers and their regions. Can be null.
460    * @throws KeeperException
461    * @throws IOException
462    * @throws InterruptedException
463    */
464   void processDeadServersAndRegionsInTransition(
465       final Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> deadServers)
466           throws KeeperException, IOException, InterruptedException {
467     List<String> nodes = ZKUtil.listChildrenNoWatch(watcher,
468       watcher.assignmentZNode);
469 
470     if (nodes == null) {
471       String errorMessage = "Failed to get the children from ZK";
472       server.abort(errorMessage, new IOException(errorMessage));
473       return;
474     }
475 
476     boolean failover = (!serverManager.getDeadServers().isEmpty() || !serverManager
477         .getRequeuedDeadServers().isEmpty());
478 
479     if (!failover) {
480       // If any one region except meta is assigned, it's a failover.
481       Map<HRegionInfo, ServerName> regions = regionStates.getRegionAssignments();
482       for (HRegionInfo hri: regions.keySet()) {
483         if (!hri.isMetaTable()) {
484           LOG.debug("Found " + hri + " out on cluster");
485           failover = true;
486           break;
487         }
488       }
489       if (!failover) {
490         // If any one region except meta is in transition, it's a failover.
491         for (String encodedName: nodes) {
492           RegionState state = regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName);
493           if (state != null && !state.getRegion().isMetaRegion()) {
494             LOG.debug("Found " + state.getRegion().getRegionNameAsString() + " in RITs");
495             failover = true;
496             break;
497           }
498         }
499       }
500     }
501 
502     // If we found user regions out on cluster, its a failover.
503     if (failover) {
504       LOG.info("Found regions out on cluster or in RIT; presuming failover");
505       // Process list of dead servers and regions in RIT.
506       // See HBASE-4580 for more information.
507       processDeadServersAndRecoverLostRegions(deadServers);
508     } else {
509       // Fresh cluster startup.
510       LOG.info("Clean cluster startup. Assigning userregions");
511       assignAllUserRegions();
512     }
513   }
514 
515   /**
516    * If region is up in zk in transition, then do fixup and block and wait until
517    * the region is assigned and out of transition.  Used on startup for
518    * catalog regions.
519    * @param hri Region to look for.
520    * @return True if we processed a region in transition else false if region
521    * was not up in zk in transition.
522    * @throws InterruptedException
523    * @throws KeeperException
524    * @throws IOException
525    */
526   boolean processRegionInTransitionAndBlockUntilAssigned(final HRegionInfo hri)
527       throws InterruptedException, KeeperException, IOException {
528     String encodedRegionName = hri.getEncodedName();
529     if (!processRegionInTransition(encodedRegionName, hri)) {
530       return false; // The region is not in transition
531     }
532     LOG.debug("Waiting on " + HRegionInfo.prettyPrint(encodedRegionName));
533     while (!this.server.isStopped() &&
534         this.regionStates.isRegionInTransition(encodedRegionName)) {
535       RegionState state = this.regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(encodedRegionName);
536       if (state == null || !serverManager.isServerOnline(state.getServerName())) {
537         // The region is not in transition, or not in transition on an online
538         // server. Doesn't help to block here any more. Caller need to
539         // verify the region is actually assigned.
540         break;
541       }
542       this.regionStates.waitForUpdate(100);
543     }
544     return true;
545   }
546 
547   /**
548    * Process failover of new master for region <code>encodedRegionName</code>
549    * up in zookeeper.
550    * @param encodedRegionName Region to process failover for.
551    * @param regionInfo If null we'll go get it from meta table.
552    * @return True if we processed <code>regionInfo</code> as a RIT.
553    * @throws KeeperException
554    * @throws IOException
555    */
556   boolean processRegionInTransition(final String encodedRegionName,
557       final HRegionInfo regionInfo) throws KeeperException, IOException {
558     // We need a lock here to ensure that we will not put the same region twice
559     // It has no reason to be a lock shared with the other operations.
560     // We can do the lock on the region only, instead of a global lock: what we want to ensure
561     // is that we don't have two threads working on the same region.
562     Lock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedRegionName);
563     try {
564       Stat stat = new Stat();
565       byte [] data = ZKAssign.getDataAndWatch(watcher, encodedRegionName, stat);
566       if (data == null) return false;
567       RegionTransition rt;
568       try {
569         rt = RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
570       } catch (DeserializationException e) {
571         LOG.warn("Failed parse znode data", e);
572         return false;
573       }
574       HRegionInfo hri = regionInfo;
575       if (hri == null) {
576         // The region info is not passed in. We will try to find the region
577         // from region states map/meta based on the encoded region name. But we
578         // may not be able to find it. This is valid for online merge that
579         // the region may have not been created if the merge is not completed.
580         // Therefore, it is not in meta at master recovery time.
581         hri = regionStates.getRegionInfo(rt.getRegionName());
582         EventType et = rt.getEventType();
583         if (hri == null && et != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING
584             && et != EventType.RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE) {
585           LOG.warn("Couldn't find the region in recovering " + rt);
586           return false;
587         }
588       }
589       return processRegionsInTransition(
590         rt, hri, stat.getVersion());
591     } finally {
592       lock.unlock();
593     }
594   }
595 
596   /**
597    * This call is invoked only (1) master assign meta;
598    * (2) during failover mode startup, zk assignment node processing.
599    * The locker is set in the caller. It returns true if the region
600    * is in transition for sure, false otherwise.
601    *
602    * It should be private but it is used by some test too.
603    */
604   boolean processRegionsInTransition(
605       final RegionTransition rt, final HRegionInfo regionInfo,
606       final int expectedVersion) throws KeeperException {
607     EventType et = rt.getEventType();
608     // Get ServerName.  Could not be null.
609     final ServerName sn = rt.getServerName();
610     final byte[] regionName = rt.getRegionName();
611     final String encodedName = HRegionInfo.encodeRegionName(regionName);
612     final String prettyPrintedRegionName = HRegionInfo.prettyPrint(encodedName);
613     LOG.info("Processing " + prettyPrintedRegionName + " in state: " + et);
614 
615     if (regionStates.isRegionInTransition(encodedName)) {
616       LOG.info("Processed region " + prettyPrintedRegionName + " in state: "
617         + et + ", does nothing since the region is already in transition "
618         + regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(encodedName));
619       // Just return
620       return true;
621     }
622     if (!serverManager.isServerOnline(sn)) {
623       // It was transitioning on a dead server, so it's closed now.
624       // Force to OFFLINE and put it in transition, but not assign it
625       // since log splitting for the dead server is not done yet.
626       LOG.debug("RIT " + encodedName + " in state=" + rt.getEventType() +
627         " was on deadserver; forcing offline");
628       if (regionStates.isRegionOnline(regionInfo)) {
629         // Meta could still show the region is assigned to the previous
630         // server. If that server is online, when we reload the meta, the
631         // region is put back to online, we need to offline it.
632         regionStates.regionOffline(regionInfo);
633       }
634       // Put it back in transition so that SSH can re-assign it
635       regionStates.updateRegionState(regionInfo, State.OFFLINE, sn);
636 
637       if (regionInfo.isMetaRegion()) {
638         // If it's meta region, reset the meta location.
639         // So that master knows the right meta region server.
640         MetaRegionTracker.setMetaLocation(watcher, sn);
641       } else {
642         // No matter the previous server is online or offline,
643         // we need to reset the last region server of the region.
644         regionStates.setLastRegionServerOfRegion(sn, encodedName);
645         // Make sure we know the server is dead.
646         if (!serverManager.isServerDead(sn)) {
647           serverManager.expireServer(sn);
648         }
649       }
650       return false;
651     }
652     switch (et) {
653       case M_ZK_REGION_CLOSING:
654         // Insert into RIT & resend the query to the region server: may be the previous master
655         // died before sending the query the first time.
656         final RegionState rsClosing = regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.CLOSING);
657         this.executorService.submit(
658           new EventHandler(server, EventType.M_MASTER_RECOVERY) {
659             @Override
660             public void process() throws IOException {
661               ReentrantLock lock = locker.acquireLock(regionInfo.getEncodedName());
662               try {
663                 unassign(regionInfo, rsClosing, expectedVersion, null, true, null);
664                 if (regionStates.isRegionOffline(regionInfo)) {
665                   assign(regionInfo, true);
666                 }
667               } finally {
668                 lock.unlock();
669               }
670             }
671           });
672         break;
673 
674       case RS_ZK_REGION_CLOSED:
675       case RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN:
676         // Region is closed, insert into RIT and handle it
677         regionStates.updateRegionState(regionInfo, State.CLOSED, sn);
678         invokeAssign(regionInfo);
679         break;
680 
681       case M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE:
682         // Insert in RIT and resend to the regionserver
683         regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.PENDING_OPEN);
684         final RegionState rsOffline = regionStates.getRegionState(regionInfo);
685         this.executorService.submit(
686           new EventHandler(server, EventType.M_MASTER_RECOVERY) {
687             @Override
688             public void process() throws IOException {
689               ReentrantLock lock = locker.acquireLock(regionInfo.getEncodedName());
690               try {
691                 RegionPlan plan = new RegionPlan(regionInfo, null, sn);
692                 addPlan(encodedName, plan);
693                 assign(rsOffline, false, false);
694               } finally {
695                 lock.unlock();
696               }
697             }
698           });
699         break;
700 
701       case RS_ZK_REGION_OPENING:
702         regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.OPENING);
703         break;
704 
705       case RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED:
706         // Region is opened, insert into RIT and handle it
707         // This could be done asynchronously, we would need then to acquire the lock in the
708         //  handler.
709         regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.OPEN);
710         new OpenedRegionHandler(server, this, regionInfo, sn, expectedVersion).process();
711         break;
712       case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_SPLIT:
713       case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLITTING:
714       case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLIT:
715         // Splitting region should be online. We could have skipped it during
716         // user region rebuilding since we may consider the split is completed.
717         // Put it in SPLITTING state to avoid complications.
718         regionStates.regionOnline(regionInfo, sn);
719         regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.SPLITTING);
720         if (!handleRegionSplitting(
721             rt, encodedName, prettyPrintedRegionName, sn)) {
722           deleteSplittingNode(encodedName, sn);
723         }
724         break;
725       case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE:
726       case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING:
727       case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED:
728         if (!handleRegionMerging(
729             rt, encodedName, prettyPrintedRegionName, sn)) {
730           deleteMergingNode(encodedName, sn);
731         }
732         break;
733       default:
734         throw new IllegalStateException("Received region in state:" + et + " is not valid.");
735     }
736     LOG.info("Processed region " + prettyPrintedRegionName + " in state "
737       + et + ", on " + (serverManager.isServerOnline(sn) ? "" : "dead ")
738       + "server: " + sn);
739     return true;
740   }
741 
742   /**
743    * When a region is closed, it should be removed from the regionsToReopen
744    * @param hri HRegionInfo of the region which was closed
745    */
746   public void removeClosedRegion(HRegionInfo hri) {
747     if (regionsToReopen.remove(hri.getEncodedName()) != null) {
748       LOG.debug("Removed region from reopening regions because it was closed");
749     }
750   }

752   /**
753    * Handles various states an unassigned node can be in.
754    * <p>
755    * Method is called when a state change is suspected for an unassigned node.
756    * <p>
757    * This deals with skipped transitions (we got a CLOSED but didn't see CLOSING
758    * yet).
759    * @param rt
760    * @param expectedVersion
761    */
762   void handleRegion(final RegionTransition rt, int expectedVersion) {
763     if (rt == null) {
764       LOG.warn("Unexpected NULL input for RegionTransition rt");
765       return;
766     }
767     final ServerName sn = rt.getServerName();
768     // Check if this is a special HBCK transition
769     if (sn.equals(HBCK_CODE_SERVERNAME)) {
770       handleHBCK(rt);
771       return;
772     }
773     final long createTime = rt.getCreateTime();
774     final byte[] regionName = rt.getRegionName();
775     String encodedName = HRegionInfo.encodeRegionName(regionName);
776     String prettyPrintedRegionName = HRegionInfo.prettyPrint(encodedName);
777     // Verify this is a known server
778     if (!serverManager.isServerOnline(sn)
779       && !ignoreStatesRSOffline.contains(rt.getEventType())) {
780       LOG.warn("Attempted to handle region transition for server but " +
781         "it is not online: " + prettyPrintedRegionName + ", " + rt);
782       return;
783     }
784 
785     RegionState regionState =
786       regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName);
787     long startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
788     if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
789       boolean lateEvent = createTime < (startTime - 15000);
790       LOG.debug("Handling " + rt.getEventType() +
791         ", server=" + sn + ", region=" +
792         (prettyPrintedRegionName == null ? "null" : prettyPrintedRegionName) +
793         (lateEvent ? ", which is more than 15 seconds late" : "") +
794         ", current_state=" + regionState);
795     }
796     // We don't do anything for this event,
797     // so separate it out, no need to lock/unlock anything
798     if (rt.getEventType() == EventType.M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE) {
799       return;
800     }
801 
802     // We need a lock on the region as we could update it
803     Lock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedName);
804     try {
805       RegionState latestState =
806         regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName);
807       if ((regionState == null && latestState != null)
808           || (regionState != null && latestState == null)
809           || (regionState != null && latestState != null
810             && latestState.getState() != regionState.getState())) {
811         LOG.warn("Region state changed from " + regionState + " to "
812           + latestState + ", while acquiring lock");
813       }
814       long waitedTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - startTime;
815       if (waitedTime > 5000) {
816         LOG.warn("Took " + waitedTime + "ms to acquire the lock");
817       }
818       regionState = latestState;
819       switch (rt.getEventType()) {
820       case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_SPLIT:
821       case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLITTING:
822       case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLIT:
823         if (!handleRegionSplitting(
824             rt, encodedName, prettyPrintedRegionName, sn)) {
825           deleteSplittingNode(encodedName, sn);
826         }
827         break;
828 
829       case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE:
830       case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING:
831       case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED:
832         // Merged region is a new region, we can't find it in the region states now.
833         // However, the two merging regions are not new. They should be in state for merging.
834         if (!handleRegionMerging(
835             rt, encodedName, prettyPrintedRegionName, sn)) {
836           deleteMergingNode(encodedName, sn);
837         }
838         break;
839 
840       case M_ZK_REGION_CLOSING:
841         // Should see CLOSING after we have asked it to CLOSE or additional
842         // times after already being in state of CLOSING
843         if (regionState == null
844             || !regionState.isPendingCloseOrClosingOnServer(sn)) {
845           LOG.warn("Received CLOSING for " + prettyPrintedRegionName
846             + " from " + sn + " but the region isn't PENDING_CLOSE/CLOSING here: "
847             + regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName));
848           return;
849         }
850         // Transition to CLOSING (or update stamp if already CLOSING)
851         regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.CLOSING);
852         break;
853 
854       case RS_ZK_REGION_CLOSED:
855         // Should see CLOSED after CLOSING but possible after PENDING_CLOSE
856         if (regionState == null
857             || !regionState.isPendingCloseOrClosingOnServer(sn)) {
858           LOG.warn("Received CLOSED for " + prettyPrintedRegionName
859             + " from " + sn + " but the region isn't PENDING_CLOSE/CLOSING here: "
860             + regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName));
861           return;
862         }
863         // Handle CLOSED by assigning elsewhere or stopping if a disable
864         // If we got here all is good.  Need to update RegionState -- else
865         // what follows will fail because not in expected state.
866         new ClosedRegionHandler(server, this, regionState.getRegion()).process();
867         updateClosedRegionHandlerTracker(regionState.getRegion());
868         break;
869 
870         case RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN:
871           if (regionState == null
872               || !regionState.isPendingOpenOrOpeningOnServer(sn)) {
873             LOG.warn("Received FAILED_OPEN for " + prettyPrintedRegionName
874               + " from " + sn + " but the region isn't PENDING_OPEN/OPENING here: "
875               + regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName));
876             return;
877           }
878           AtomicInteger failedOpenCount = failedOpenTracker.get(encodedName);
879           if (failedOpenCount == null) {
880             failedOpenCount = new AtomicInteger();
881             // No need to use putIfAbsent, or extra synchronization since
882             // this whole handleRegion block is locked on the encoded region
883             // name, and failedOpenTracker is updated only in this block
884             failedOpenTracker.put(encodedName, failedOpenCount);
885           }
886           if (failedOpenCount.incrementAndGet() >= maximumAttempts) {
887             regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.FAILED_OPEN);
888             // remove the tracking info to save memory, also reset
889             // the count for next open initiative
890             failedOpenTracker.remove(encodedName);
891           } else {
892             // Handle this the same as if it were opened and then closed.
893             regionState = regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.CLOSED);
894             if (regionState != null) {
895               // When there are more than one region server a new RS is selected as the
896               // destination and the same is updated in the regionplan. (HBASE-5546)
897               try {
898                 getRegionPlan(regionState.getRegion(), sn, true);
899                 new ClosedRegionHandler(server, this, regionState.getRegion()).process();
900               } catch (HBaseIOException e) {
901                 LOG.warn("Failed to get region plan", e);
902               }
903             }
904           }
905           break;
906 
907         case RS_ZK_REGION_OPENING:
908           // Should see OPENING after we have asked it to OPEN or additional
909           // times after already being in state of OPENING
910           if (regionState == null
911               || !regionState.isPendingOpenOrOpeningOnServer(sn)) {
912             LOG.warn("Received OPENING for " + prettyPrintedRegionName
913               + " from " + sn + " but the region isn't PENDING_OPEN/OPENING here: "
914               + regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName));
915             return;
916           }
917           // Transition to OPENING (or update stamp if already OPENING)
918           regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.OPENING);
919           break;
920 
921         case RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED:
922           // Should see OPENED after OPENING but possible after PENDING_OPEN.
923           if (regionState == null
924               || !regionState.isPendingOpenOrOpeningOnServer(sn)) {
925             LOG.warn("Received OPENED for " + prettyPrintedRegionName
926               + " from " + sn + " but the region isn't PENDING_OPEN/OPENING here: "
927               + regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName));
928 
929             // Close it without updating the internal region states,
930             // so as not to create double assignments in unlucky scenarios
931             // mentioned in OpenRegionHandler#process
932             unassign(regionState.getRegion(), null, -1, null, false, sn);
933             return;
934           }
935           // Handle OPENED by removing from transition and deleted zk node
936           regionState = regionStates.updateRegionState(rt, State.OPEN);
937           if (regionState != null) {
938             failedOpenTracker.remove(encodedName); // reset the count, if any
939             new OpenedRegionHandler(
940               server, this, regionState.getRegion(), sn, expectedVersion).process();
941             updateOpenedRegionHandlerTracker(regionState.getRegion());
942           }
943           break;
944 
945         default:
946           throw new IllegalStateException("Received event is not valid.");
947       }
948     } finally {
949       lock.unlock();
950     }
951   }

953   //For unit tests only
954   boolean wasClosedHandlerCalled(HRegionInfo hri) {
955     AtomicBoolean b = closedRegionHandlerCalled.get(hri);
956     //compareAndSet to be sure that unit tests don't see stale values. Means,
957     //we will return true exactly once unless the handler code resets to true
958     //this value.
959     return b == null ? false : b.compareAndSet(true, false);
960   }
961 
962   //For unit tests only
963   boolean wasOpenedHandlerCalled(HRegionInfo hri) {
964     AtomicBoolean b = openedRegionHandlerCalled.get(hri);
965     //compareAndSet to be sure that unit tests don't see stale values. Means,
966     //we will return true exactly once unless the handler code resets to true
967     //this value.
968     return b == null ? false : b.compareAndSet(true, false);
969   }

989   // TODO: processFavoredNodes might throw an exception, for e.g., if the
990   // meta could not be contacted/updated. We need to see how seriously to treat
991   // this problem as. Should we fail the current assignment. We should be able
992   // to recover from this problem eventually (if the meta couldn't be updated
993   // things should work normally and eventually get fixed up).
994   void processFavoredNodes(List<HRegionInfo> regions) throws IOException {
995     if (!shouldAssignRegionsWithFavoredNodes) return;
996     // The AM gets the favored nodes info for each region and updates the meta
997     // table with that info
998     Map<HRegionInfo, List<ServerName>> regionToFavoredNodes =
999         new HashMap<HRegionInfo, List<ServerName>>();
1000     for (HRegionInfo region : regions) {
1001       regionToFavoredNodes.put(region,
1002           ((FavoredNodeLoadBalancer)this.balancer).getFavoredNodes(region));
1003     }
1004     FavoredNodeAssignmentHelper.updateMetaWithFavoredNodesInfo(regionToFavoredNodes, catalogTracker);
1005   }

1007   /**
1008    * Handle a ZK unassigned node transition triggered by HBCK repair tool.
1009    * <p>
1010    * This is handled in a separate code path because it breaks the normal rules.
1011    * @param rt
1012    */
1013   private void handleHBCK(RegionTransition rt) {
1014     String encodedName = HRegionInfo.encodeRegionName(rt.getRegionName());
1015     LOG.info("Handling HBCK triggered transition=" + rt.getEventType() +
1016       ", server=" + rt.getServerName() + ", region=" +
1017       HRegionInfo.prettyPrint(encodedName));
1018     RegionState regionState = regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(encodedName);
1019     switch (rt.getEventType()) {
1020       case M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE:
1021         HRegionInfo regionInfo;
1022         if (regionState != null) {
1023           regionInfo = regionState.getRegion();
1024         } else {
1025           try {
1026             byte [] name = rt.getRegionName();
1027             Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> p = MetaReader.getRegion(catalogTracker, name);
1028             regionInfo = p.getFirst();
1029           } catch (IOException e) {
1030             LOG.info("Exception reading hbase:meta doing HBCK repair operation", e);
1031             return;
1032           }
1033         }
1034         LOG.info("HBCK repair is triggering assignment of region=" +
1035             regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
1036         // trigger assign, node is already in OFFLINE so don't need to update ZK
1037         assign(regionInfo, false);
1038         break;
1039 
1040       default:
1041         LOG.warn("Received unexpected region state from HBCK: " + rt.toString());
1042         break;
1043     }
1044 
1045   }

1084   // We  don't want to have two events on the same region managed simultaneously.
1085   // For this reason, we need to wait if an event on the same region is currently in progress.
1086   // So we track the region names of the events in progress, and we keep a waiting list.
1087   private final Set<String> regionsInProgress = new HashSet<String>();
1088   // In a LinkedHashMultimap, the put order is kept when we retrieve the collection back. We need
1089   //  this as we want the events to be managed in the same order as we received them.
1090   private final LinkedHashMultimap <String, RegionRunnable>
1091       zkEventWorkerWaitingList = LinkedHashMultimap.create();
1092 
1093   /**
1094    * A specific runnable that works only on a region.
1095    */
1096   private interface RegionRunnable extends Runnable{
1097     /**
1098      * @return - the name of the region it works on.
1099      */
1100     String getRegionName();
1101   }
1102 
1103   /**
1104    * Submit a task, ensuring that there is only one task at a time that working on a given region.
1105    * Order is respected.
1106    */
1107   protected void zkEventWorkersSubmit(final RegionRunnable regRunnable) {
1108 
1109     synchronized (regionsInProgress) {
1110       // If we're there is already a task with this region, we add it to the
1111       //  waiting list and return.
1112       if (regionsInProgress.contains(regRunnable.getRegionName())) {
1113         synchronized (zkEventWorkerWaitingList){
1114           zkEventWorkerWaitingList.put(regRunnable.getRegionName(), regRunnable);
1115         }
1116         return;
1117       }
1118 
1119       // No event in progress on this region => we can submit a new task immediately.
1120       regionsInProgress.add(regRunnable.getRegionName());
1121       zkEventWorkers.submit(new Runnable() {
1122         @Override
1123         public void run() {
1124           try {
1125             regRunnable.run();
1126           } finally {
1127             // now that we have finished, let's see if there is an event for the same region in the
1128             //  waiting list. If it's the case, we can now submit it to the pool.
1129             synchronized (regionsInProgress) {
1130               regionsInProgress.remove(regRunnable.getRegionName());
1131               synchronized (zkEventWorkerWaitingList) {
1132                 java.util.Set<RegionRunnable> waiting = zkEventWorkerWaitingList.get(
1133                     regRunnable.getRegionName());
1134                 if (!waiting.isEmpty()) {
1135                   // We want the first object only. The only way to get it is through an iterator.
1136                   RegionRunnable toSubmit = waiting.iterator().next();
1137                   zkEventWorkerWaitingList.remove(toSubmit.getRegionName(), toSubmit);
1138                   zkEventWorkersSubmit(toSubmit);
1139                 }
1140               }
1141             }
1142           }
1143         }
1144       });
1145     }
1146   }
1147 
1148   @Override
1149   public void nodeDeleted(final String path) {
1150     if (path.startsWith(watcher.assignmentZNode)) {
1151       final String regionName = ZKAssign.getRegionName(watcher, path);
1152       zkEventWorkersSubmit(new RegionRunnable() {
1153         @Override
1154         public String getRegionName() {
1155           return regionName;
1156         }
1157 
1158         @Override
1159         public void run() {
1160           Lock lock = locker.acquireLock(regionName);
1161           try {
1162             RegionState rs = regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(regionName);
1163             if (rs == null) {
1164               rs = regionStates.getRegionState(regionName);
1165               if (rs == null || !rs.isMergingNew()) {
1166                 // MergingNew is an offline state
1167                 return;
1168               }
1169             }
1170 
1171             HRegionInfo regionInfo = rs.getRegion();
1172             String regionNameStr = regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString();
1173             LOG.debug("Znode " + regionNameStr + " deleted, state: " + rs);
1174             boolean disabled = getZKTable().isDisablingOrDisabledTable(regionInfo.getTable());
1175             ServerName serverName = rs.getServerName();
1176             if (serverManager.isServerOnline(serverName)) {
1177               if (rs.isOnServer(serverName)
1178                   && (rs.isOpened() || rs.isSplitting())) {
1179                 regionOnline(regionInfo, serverName);
1180                 if (disabled) {
1181                   // if server is offline, no hurt to unassign again
1182                   LOG.info("Opened " + regionNameStr
1183                     + "but this table is disabled, triggering close of region");
1184                   unassign(regionInfo);
1185                 }
1186               } else if (rs.isMergingNew()) {
1187                 synchronized (regionStates) {
1188                   String p = regionInfo.getEncodedName();
1189                   PairOfSameType<HRegionInfo> regions = mergingRegions.get(p);
1190                   if (regions != null) {
1191                     onlineMergingRegion(disabled, regions.getFirst(), serverName);
1192                     onlineMergingRegion(disabled, regions.getSecond(), serverName);
1193                   }
1194                 }
1195               }
1196             }
1197           } finally {
1198             lock.unlock();
1199           }
1200         }
1201 
1202         private void onlineMergingRegion(boolean disabled,
1203             final HRegionInfo hri, final ServerName serverName) {
1204           RegionState regionState = regionStates.getRegionState(hri);
1205           if (regionState != null && regionState.isMerging()
1206               && regionState.isOnServer(serverName)) {
1207             regionOnline(regionState.getRegion(), serverName);
1208             if (disabled) {
1209               unassign(hri);
1210             }
1211           }
1212         }
1213       });
1214     }
1215   }
1216 
1217   /**
1218    * New unassigned node has been created.
1219    *
1220    * <p>This happens when an RS begins the OPENING, SPLITTING or CLOSING of a
1221    * region by creating a znode.
1222    *
1223    * <p>When this happens we must:
1224    * <ol>
1225    *   <li>Watch the node for further children changed events</li>
1226    *   <li>Watch all new children for changed events</li>
1227    * </ol>
1228    */
1229   @Override
1230   public void nodeChildrenChanged(String path) {
1231     if (path.equals(watcher.assignmentZNode)) {
1232       zkEventWorkers.submit(new Runnable() {
1233         @Override
1234         public void run() {
1235           try {
1236             // Just make sure we see the changes for the new znodes
1237             List<String> children =
1238               ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(
1239                 watcher, watcher.assignmentZNode);
1240             if (children != null) {
1241               Stat stat = new Stat();
1242               for (String child : children) {
1243                 // if region is in transition, we already have a watch
1244                 // on it, so no need to watch it again. So, as I know for now,
1245                 // this is needed to watch splitting nodes only.
1246                 if (!regionStates.isRegionInTransition(child)) {
1247                   ZKAssign.getDataAndWatch(watcher, child, stat);
1248                 }
1249               }
1250             }
1251           } catch (KeeperException e) {
1252             server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception reading unassigned children", e);
1253           }
1254         }
1255       });
1256     }
1257   }
1258 
1259   /**
1260    * Marks the region as online.  Removes it from regions in transition and
1261    * updates the in-memory assignment information.
1262    * <p>
1263    * Used when a region has been successfully opened on a region server.
1264    * @param regionInfo
1265    * @param sn
1266    */
1267   void regionOnline(HRegionInfo regionInfo, ServerName sn) {
1268     numRegionsOpened.incrementAndGet();
1269     regionStates.regionOnline(regionInfo, sn);
1270 
1271     // Remove plan if one.
1272     clearRegionPlan(regionInfo);
1273     // Add the server to serversInUpdatingTimer
1274     addToServersInUpdatingTimer(sn);
1275   }

1277   /**
1278    * Pass the assignment event to a worker for processing.
1279    * Each worker is a single thread executor service.  The reason
1280    * for just one thread is to make sure all events for a given
1281    * region are processed in order.
1282    *
1283    * @param path
1284    */
1285   private void handleAssignmentEvent(final String path) {
1286     if (path.startsWith(watcher.assignmentZNode)) {
1287       final String regionName = ZKAssign.getRegionName(watcher, path);
1288 
1289       zkEventWorkersSubmit(new RegionRunnable() {
1290         @Override
1291         public String getRegionName() {
1292           return regionName;
1293         }
1294 
1295         @Override
1296         public void run() {
1297           try {
1298             Stat stat = new Stat();
1299             byte [] data = ZKAssign.getDataAndWatch(watcher, path, stat);
1300             if (data == null) return;
1301 
1302             RegionTransition rt = RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
1303             handleRegion(rt, stat.getVersion());
1304           } catch (KeeperException e) {
1305             server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception reading unassigned node data", e);
1306           } catch (DeserializationException e) {
1307             server.abort("Unexpected exception deserializing node data", e);
1308           }
1309         }
1310       });
1311     }
1312   }

1314   /**
1315    * Add the server to the set serversInUpdatingTimer, then {@link TimerUpdater}
1316    * will update timers for this server in background
1317    * @param sn
1318    */
1319   private void addToServersInUpdatingTimer(final ServerName sn) {
1320     if (tomActivated){
1321       this.serversInUpdatingTimer.add(sn);
1322     }
1323   }

1325   /**
1326    * Touch timers for all regions in transition that have the passed
1327    * <code>sn</code> in common.
1328    * Call this method whenever a server checks in.  Doing so helps the case where
1329    * a new regionserver has joined the cluster and its been given 1k regions to
1330    * open.  If this method is tickled every time the region reports in a
1331    * successful open then the 1k-th region won't be timed out just because its
1332    * sitting behind the open of 999 other regions.  This method is NOT used
1333    * as part of bulk assign -- there we have a different mechanism for extending
1334    * the regions in transition timer (we turn it off temporarily -- because
1335    * there is no regionplan involved when bulk assigning.
1336    * @param sn
1337    */
1338   private void updateTimers(final ServerName sn) {
1339     Preconditions.checkState(tomActivated);
1340     if (sn == null) return;
1341 
1342     // This loop could be expensive.
1343     // First make a copy of current regionPlan rather than hold sync while
1344     // looping because holding sync can cause deadlock.  Its ok in this loop
1345     // if the Map we're going against is a little stale
1346     List<Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan>> rps;
1347     synchronized(this.regionPlans) {
1348       rps = new ArrayList<Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan>>(regionPlans.entrySet());
1349     }
1350 
1351     for (Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan> e : rps) {
1352       if (e.getValue() != null && e.getKey() != null && sn.equals(e.getValue().getDestination())) {
1353         RegionState regionState = regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(e.getKey());
1354         if (regionState != null) {
1355           regionState.updateTimestampToNow();
1356         }
1357       }
1358     }
1359   }

1362    * Marks the region as offline.  Removes it from regions in transition and
1363    * removes in-memory assignment information.
1364    * <p>
1365    * Used when a region has been closed and should remain closed.
1366    * @param regionInfo
1367    */
1368   public void regionOffline(final HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
1369     regionOffline(regionInfo, null);
1370   }

1372   public void offlineDisabledRegion(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
1373     // Disabling so should not be reassigned, just delete the CLOSED node
1374     LOG.debug("Table being disabled so deleting ZK node and removing from " +
1375       "regions in transition, skipping assignment of region " +
1376         regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
1377     String encodedName = regionInfo.getEncodedName();
1378     deleteNodeInStates(encodedName, "closed", null,
1379       EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_CLOSED, EventType.M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE);
1380     regionOffline(regionInfo);
1381   }

1385   /**
1386    * Assigns the specified region.
1387    * <p>
1388    * If a RegionPlan is available with a valid destination then it will be used
1389    * to determine what server region is assigned to.  If no RegionPlan is
1390    * available, region will be assigned to a random available server.
1391    * <p>
1392    * Updates the RegionState and sends the OPEN RPC.
1393    * <p>
1394    * This will only succeed if the region is in transition and in a CLOSED or
1395    * OFFLINE state or not in transition (in-memory not zk), and of course, the
1396    * chosen server is up and running (It may have just crashed!).  If the
1397    * in-memory checks pass, the zk node is forced to OFFLINE before assigning.
1398    *
1399    * @param region server to be assigned
1400    * @param setOfflineInZK whether ZK node should be created/transitioned to an
1401    *                       OFFLINE state before assigning the region
1402    */
1403   public void assign(HRegionInfo region, boolean setOfflineInZK) {
1404     assign(region, setOfflineInZK, false);
1405   }
1406 
1407   /**
1408    * Use care with forceNewPlan. It could cause double assignment.
1409    */
1410   public void assign(HRegionInfo region,
1411       boolean setOfflineInZK, boolean forceNewPlan) {
1412     if (isDisabledorDisablingRegionInRIT(region)) {
1413       return;
1414     }
1415     if (this.serverManager.isClusterShutdown()) {
1416       LOG.info("Cluster shutdown is set; skipping assign of " +
1417         region.getRegionNameAsString());
1418       return;
1419     }
1420     String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
1421     Lock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedName);
1422     try {
1423       RegionState state = forceRegionStateToOffline(region, forceNewPlan);
1424       if (state != null) {
1425         if (regionStates.wasRegionOnDeadServer(encodedName)) {
1426           LOG.info("Skip assigning " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1427             + ", it's host " + regionStates.getLastRegionServerOfRegion(encodedName)
1428             + " is dead but not processed yet");
1429           return;
1430         }
1431         assign(state, setOfflineInZK, forceNewPlan);
1432       }
1433     } finally {
1434       lock.unlock();
1435     }
1436   }
1437 
1438   /**
1439    * Bulk assign regions to <code>destination</code>.
1440    * @param destination
1441    * @param regions Regions to assign.
1442    * @return true if successful
1443    */
1444   boolean assign(final ServerName destination, final List<HRegionInfo> regions) {
1445     long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1446     try {
1447       int regionCount = regions.size();
1448       if (regionCount == 0) {
1449         return true;
1450       }
1451       LOG.debug("Assigning " + regionCount + " region(s) to " + destination.toString());
1452       Set<String> encodedNames = new HashSet<String>(regionCount);
1453       for (HRegionInfo region : regions) {
1454         encodedNames.add(region.getEncodedName());
1455       }
1456 
1457       List<HRegionInfo> failedToOpenRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
1458       Map<String, Lock> locks = locker.acquireLocks(encodedNames);
1459       try {
1460         AtomicInteger counter = new AtomicInteger(0);
1461         Map<String, Integer> offlineNodesVersions = new ConcurrentHashMap<String, Integer>();
1462         OfflineCallback cb = new OfflineCallback(
1463           watcher, destination, counter, offlineNodesVersions);
1464         Map<String, RegionPlan> plans = new HashMap<String, RegionPlan>(regions.size());
1465         List<RegionState> states = new ArrayList<RegionState>(regions.size());
1466         for (HRegionInfo region : regions) {
1467           String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
1468           if (!isDisabledorDisablingRegionInRIT(region)) {
1469             RegionState state = forceRegionStateToOffline(region, false);
1470             boolean onDeadServer = false;
1471             if (state != null) {
1472               if (regionStates.wasRegionOnDeadServer(encodedName)) {
1473                 LOG.info("Skip assigning " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1474                   + ", it's host " + regionStates.getLastRegionServerOfRegion(encodedName)
1475                   + " is dead but not processed yet");
1476                 onDeadServer = true;
1477               } else if (asyncSetOfflineInZooKeeper(state, cb, destination)) {
1478                 RegionPlan plan = new RegionPlan(region, state.getServerName(), destination);
1479                 plans.put(encodedName, plan);
1480                 states.add(state);
1481                 continue;
1482               }
1483             }
1484             // Reassign if the region wasn't on a dead server
1485             if (!onDeadServer) {
1486               LOG.info("failed to force region state to offline or "
1487                 + "failed to set it offline in ZK, will reassign later: " + region);
1488               failedToOpenRegions.add(region); // assign individually later
1489             }
1490           }
1491           // Release the lock, this region is excluded from bulk assign because
1492           // we can't update its state, or set its znode to offline.
1493           Lock lock = locks.remove(encodedName);
1494           lock.unlock();
1495         }
1496 
1497         // Wait until all unassigned nodes have been put up and watchers set.
1498         int total = states.size();
1499         for (int oldCounter = 0; !server.isStopped();) {
1500           int count = counter.get();
1501           if (oldCounter != count) {
1502             LOG.info(destination.toString() + " unassigned znodes=" + count +
1503               " of total=" + total);
1504             oldCounter = count;
1505           }
1506           if (count >= total) break;
1507           Threads.sleep(5);
1508         }
1509 
1510         if (server.isStopped()) {
1511           return false;
1512         }
1513 
1514         // Add region plans, so we can updateTimers when one region is opened so
1515         // that unnecessary timeout on RIT is reduced.
1516         this.addPlans(plans);
1517 
1518         List<Triple<HRegionInfo, Integer, List<ServerName>>> regionOpenInfos =
1519           new ArrayList<Triple<HRegionInfo, Integer, List<ServerName>>>(states.size());
1520         for (RegionState state: states) {
1521           HRegionInfo region = state.getRegion();
1522           String encodedRegionName = region.getEncodedName();
1523           Integer nodeVersion = offlineNodesVersions.get(encodedRegionName);
1524           if (nodeVersion == null || nodeVersion == -1) {
1525             LOG.warn("failed to offline in zookeeper: " + region);
1526             failedToOpenRegions.add(region); // assign individually later
1527             Lock lock = locks.remove(encodedRegionName);
1528             lock.unlock();
1529           } else {
1530             regionStates.updateRegionState(
1531               region, State.PENDING_OPEN, destination);
1532             List<ServerName> favoredNodes = ServerName.EMPTY_SERVER_LIST;
1533             if (this.shouldAssignRegionsWithFavoredNodes) {
1534               favoredNodes = ((FavoredNodeLoadBalancer)this.balancer).getFavoredNodes(region);
1535             }
1536             regionOpenInfos.add(new Triple<HRegionInfo, Integer,  List<ServerName>>(
1537               region, nodeVersion, favoredNodes));
1538           }
1539         }
1540 
1541         // Move on to open regions.
1542         try {
1543           // Send OPEN RPC. If it fails on a IOE or RemoteException,
1544           // regions will be assigned individually.
1545           long maxWaitTime = System.currentTimeMillis() +
1546             this.server.getConfiguration().
1547               getLong("hbase.regionserver.rpc.startup.waittime", 60000);
1548           for (int i = 1; i <= maximumAttempts && !server.isStopped(); i++) {
1549             try {
1550               List<RegionOpeningState> regionOpeningStateList = serverManager
1551                 .sendRegionOpen(destination, regionOpenInfos);
1552               if (regionOpeningStateList == null) {
1553                 // Failed getting RPC connection to this server
1554                 return false;
1555               }
1556               for (int k = 0, n = regionOpeningStateList.size(); k < n; k++) {
1557                 RegionOpeningState openingState = regionOpeningStateList.get(k);
1558                 if (openingState != RegionOpeningState.OPENED) {
1559                   HRegionInfo region = regionOpenInfos.get(k).getFirst();
1560                   if (openingState == RegionOpeningState.ALREADY_OPENED) {
1561                     processAlreadyOpenedRegion(region, destination);
1562                   } else if (openingState == RegionOpeningState.FAILED_OPENING) {
1563                     // Failed opening this region, reassign it later
1564                     failedToOpenRegions.add(region);
1565                   } else {
1566                     LOG.warn("THIS SHOULD NOT HAPPEN: unknown opening state "
1567                       + openingState + " in assigning region " + region);
1568                   }
1569                 }
1570               }
1571               break;
1572             } catch (IOException e) {
1573               if (e instanceof RemoteException) {
1574                 e = ((RemoteException)e).unwrapRemoteException();
1575               }
1576               if (e instanceof RegionServerStoppedException) {
1577                 LOG.warn("The region server was shut down, ", e);
1578                 // No need to retry, the region server is a goner.
1579                 return false;
1580               } else if (e instanceof ServerNotRunningYetException) {
1581                 long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
1582                 if (now < maxWaitTime) {
1583                   LOG.debug("Server is not yet up; waiting up to " +
1584                     (maxWaitTime - now) + "ms", e);
1585                   Thread.sleep(100);
1586                   i--; // reset the try count
1587                   continue;
1588                 }
1589               } else if (e instanceof java.net.SocketTimeoutException
1590                   && this.serverManager.isServerOnline(destination)) {
1591                 // In case socket is timed out and the region server is still online,
1592                 // the openRegion RPC could have been accepted by the server and
1593                 // just the response didn't go through.  So we will retry to
1594                 // open the region on the same server.
1595                 if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1596                   LOG.debug("Bulk assigner openRegion() to " + destination
1597                     + " has timed out, but the regions might"
1598                     + " already be opened on it.", e);
1599                 }
1600                 continue;
1601               }
1602               throw e;
1603             }
1604           }
1605         } catch (IOException e) {
1606           // Can be a socket timeout, EOF, NoRouteToHost, etc
1607           LOG.info("Unable to communicate with " + destination
1608             + " in order to assign regions, ", e);
1609           return false;
1610         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1611           throw new RuntimeException(e);
1612         }
1613       } finally {
1614         for (Lock lock : locks.values()) {
1615           lock.unlock();
1616         }
1617       }
1618 
1619       if (!failedToOpenRegions.isEmpty()) {
1620         for (HRegionInfo region : failedToOpenRegions) {
1621           if (!regionStates.isRegionOnline(region)) {
1622             invokeAssign(region);
1623           }
1624         }
1625       }
1626       LOG.debug("Bulk assigning done for " + destination);
1627       return true;
1628     } finally {
1629       metricsAssignmentManager.updateBulkAssignTime(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
1630     }
1631   }
1632 
1633   /**
1634    * Send CLOSE RPC if the server is online, otherwise, offline the region.
1635    *
1636    * The RPC will be sent only to the region sever found in the region state
1637    * if it is passed in, otherwise, to the src server specified. If region
1638    * state is not specified, we don't update region state at all, instead
1639    * we just send the RPC call. This is useful for some cleanup without
1640    * messing around the region states (see handleRegion, on region opened
1641    * on an unexpected server scenario, for an example)
1642    */
1643   private void unassign(final HRegionInfo region,
1644       final RegionState state, final int versionOfClosingNode,
1645       final ServerName dest, final boolean transitionInZK,
1646       final ServerName src) {
1647     ServerName server = src;
1648     if (state != null) {
1649       server = state.getServerName();
1650     }
1651     long maxWaitTime = -1;
1652     for (int i = 1; i <= this.maximumAttempts; i++) {
1653       if (this.server.isStopped() || this.server.isAborted()) {
1654         LOG.debug("Server stopped/aborted; skipping unassign of " + region);
1655         return;
1656       }
1657       // ClosedRegionhandler can remove the server from this.regions
1658       if (!serverManager.isServerOnline(server)) {
1659         LOG.debug("Offline " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1660           + ", no need to unassign since it's on a dead server: " + server);
1661         if (transitionInZK) {
1662           // delete the node. if no node exists need not bother.
1663           deleteClosingOrClosedNode(region, server);
1664         }
1665         if (state != null) {
1666           regionOffline(region);
1667         }
1668         return;
1669       }
1670       try {
1671         // Send CLOSE RPC
1672         if (serverManager.sendRegionClose(server, region,
1673           versionOfClosingNode, dest, transitionInZK)) {
1674           LOG.debug("Sent CLOSE to " + server + " for region " +
1675             region.getRegionNameAsString());
1676           if (!transitionInZK && state != null) {
1677             // Retry to make sure the region is
1678             // closed so as to avoid double assignment.
1679             unassign(region, state, versionOfClosingNode,
1680               dest, transitionInZK,src);
1681           }
1682           return;
1683         }
1684         // This never happens. Currently regionserver close always return true.
1685         // Todo; this can now happen (0.96) if there is an exception in a coprocessor
1686         LOG.warn("Server " + server + " region CLOSE RPC returned false for " +
1687           region.getRegionNameAsString());
1688       } catch (Throwable t) {
1689         if (t instanceof RemoteException) {
1690           t = ((RemoteException)t).unwrapRemoteException();
1691         }
1692         if (t instanceof NotServingRegionException
1693             || t instanceof RegionServerStoppedException) {
1694           LOG.debug("Offline " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1695             + ", it's not any more on " + server, t);
1696           if (transitionInZK) {
1697             deleteClosingOrClosedNode(region, server);
1698           }
1699           if (state != null) {
1700             regionOffline(region);
1701           }
1702           return;
1703         } else if (state != null
1704             && t instanceof RegionAlreadyInTransitionException) {
1705           // RS is already processing this region, only need to update the timestamp
1706           LOG.debug("update " + state + " the timestamp.");
1707           state.updateTimestampToNow();
1708           if (maxWaitTime < 0) {
1709             maxWaitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()
1710               + this.server.getConfiguration().getLong(ALREADY_IN_TRANSITION_WAITTIME,
1711                 DEFAULT_ALREADY_IN_TRANSITION_WAITTIME);
1712           }
1713           try {
1714             long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1715             if (now < maxWaitTime) {
1716               LOG.debug("Region is already in transition; "
1717                 + "waiting up to " + (maxWaitTime - now) + "ms", t);
1718               Thread.sleep(100);
1719               i--; // reset the try count
1720             }
1721           } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1722             LOG.warn("Failed to unassign "
1723               + region.getRegionNameAsString() + " since interrupted", ie);
1724             Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1725             if (!tomActivated) {
1726               regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_CLOSE);
1727             }
1728             return;
1729           }
1730         } else {
1731           LOG.info("Server " + server + " returned " + t + " for "
1732             + region.getRegionNameAsString() + ", try=" + i
1733             + " of " + this.maximumAttempts, t);
1734           // Presume retry or server will expire.
1735         }
1736       }
1737     }
1738     // Run out of attempts
1739     if (!tomActivated && state != null) {
1740       regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_CLOSE);
1741     }
1742   }
1743 
1744   /**
1745    * Set region to OFFLINE unless it is opening and forceNewPlan is false.
1746    */
1747   private RegionState forceRegionStateToOffline(
1748       final HRegionInfo region, final boolean forceNewPlan) {
1749     RegionState state = regionStates.getRegionState(region);
1750     if (state == null) {
1751       LOG.warn("Assigning a region not in region states: " + region);
1752       state = regionStates.createRegionState(region);
1753     }
1754 
1755     ServerName sn = state.getServerName();
1756     if (forceNewPlan && LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1757       LOG.debug("Force region state offline " + state);
1758     }
1759 
1760     switch (state.getState()) {
1761     case OPEN:
1762     case OPENING:
1763     case PENDING_OPEN:
1764     case CLOSING:
1765     case PENDING_CLOSE:
1766       if (!forceNewPlan) {
1767         LOG.debug("Skip assigning " +
1768           region + ", it is already " + state);
1769         return null;
1770       }
1771     case FAILED_CLOSE:
1772     case FAILED_OPEN:
1773       unassign(region, state, -1, null, false, null);
1774       state = regionStates.getRegionState(region);
1775       if (state.isFailedClose()) {
1776         // If we can't close the region, we can't re-assign
1777         // it so as to avoid possible double assignment/data loss.
1778         LOG.info("Skip assigning " +
1779           region + ", we couldn't close it: " + state);
1780         return null;
1781       }
1782     case OFFLINE:
1783       // This region could have been open on this server
1784       // for a while. If the server is dead and not processed
1785       // yet, we can move on only if the meta shows the
1786       // region is not on this server actually, or on a server
1787       // not dead, or dead and processed already.
1788       if (regionStates.isServerDeadAndNotProcessed(sn)
1789           && wasRegionOnDeadServerByMeta(region, sn)) {
1790         LOG.info("Skip assigning " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1791           + ", it is on a dead but not processed yet server");
1792         return null;
1793       }
1794     case CLOSED:
1795       break;
1796     default:
1797       LOG.error("Trying to assign region " + region
1798         + ", which is " + state);
1799       return null;
1800     }
1801     return state;
1802   }
1803 
1804   private boolean wasRegionOnDeadServerByMeta(
1805       final HRegionInfo region, final ServerName sn) {
1806     try {
1807       if (region.isMetaRegion()) {
1808         ServerName server = catalogTracker.getMetaLocation();
1809         return regionStates.isServerDeadAndNotProcessed(server);
1810       }
1811       while (!server.isStopped()) {
1812         try {
1813           catalogTracker.waitForMeta();
1814           Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> r =
1815             MetaReader.getRegion(catalogTracker, region.getRegionName());
1816           ServerName server = r == null ? null : r.getSecond();
1817           return regionStates.isServerDeadAndNotProcessed(server);
1818         } catch (IOException ioe) {
1819           LOG.info("Received exception accessing hbase:meta during force assign "
1820             + region.getRegionNameAsString() + ", retrying", ioe);
1821         }
1822       }
1823     } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1824       Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1825       LOG.info("Interrupted accessing hbase:meta", e);
1826     }
1827     // Call is interrupted or server is stopped.
1828     return regionStates.isServerDeadAndNotProcessed(sn);
1829   }
1830 
1831   /**
1832    * Caller must hold lock on the passed <code>state</code> object.
1833    * @param state
1834    * @param setOfflineInZK
1835    * @param forceNewPlan
1836    */
1837   private void assign(RegionState state,
1838       final boolean setOfflineInZK, final boolean forceNewPlan) {
1839     long startTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1840     try {
1841       RegionState currentState = state;
1842       int versionOfOfflineNode = -1;
1843       RegionPlan plan = null;
1844       long maxWaitTime = -1;
1845       HRegionInfo region = state.getRegion();
1846       RegionOpeningState regionOpenState;
1847       for (int i = 1; i <= maximumAttempts; i++) {
1848         if (server.isStopped() || server.isAborted()) {
1849           LOG.info("Skip assigning " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
1850             + ", the server is stopped/aborted");
1851           return;
1852         }
1853         if (plan == null) { // Get a server for the region at first
1854           try {
1855             plan = getRegionPlan(region, forceNewPlan);
1856           } catch (HBaseIOException e) {
1857             LOG.warn("Failed to get region plan", e);
1858           }
1859         }
1860         if (plan == null) {
1861           LOG.warn("Unable to determine a plan to assign " + region);
1862           if (tomActivated){
1863             this.timeoutMonitor.setAllRegionServersOffline(true);
1864           } else {
1865             if (region.isMetaRegion()) {
1866               try {
1867                 if (i != maximumAttempts) {
1868                   Thread.sleep(this.sleepTimeBeforeRetryingMetaAssignment);
1869                   continue;
1870                 }
1871                 // TODO : Ensure HBCK fixes this
1872                 LOG.error("Unable to determine a plan to assign hbase:meta even after repeated attempts. Run HBCK to fix this");
1873               } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1874                 LOG.error("Got exception while waiting for hbase:meta assignment");
1875                 Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1876               }
1877             }
1878             regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_OPEN);
1879           }
1880           return;
1881         }
1882         if (setOfflineInZK && versionOfOfflineNode == -1) {
1883           // get the version of the znode after setting it to OFFLINE.
1884           // versionOfOfflineNode will be -1 if the znode was not set to OFFLINE
1885           versionOfOfflineNode = setOfflineInZooKeeper(currentState, plan.getDestination());
1886           if (versionOfOfflineNode != -1) {
1887             if (isDisabledorDisablingRegionInRIT(region)) {
1888               return;
1889             }
1890             // In case of assignment from EnableTableHandler table state is ENABLING. Any how
1891             // EnableTableHandler will set ENABLED after assigning all the table regions. If we
1892             // try to set to ENABLED directly then client API may think table is enabled.
1893             // When we have a case such as all the regions are added directly into hbase:meta and we call
1894             // assignRegion then we need to make the table ENABLED. Hence in such case the table
1895             // will not be in ENABLING or ENABLED state.
1896             TableName tableName = region.getTable();
1897             if (!zkTable.isEnablingTable(tableName) && !zkTable.isEnabledTable(tableName)) {
1898               LOG.debug("Setting table " + tableName + " to ENABLED state.");
1899               setEnabledTable(tableName);
1900             }
1901           }
1902         }
1903         if (setOfflineInZK && versionOfOfflineNode == -1) {
1904           LOG.info("Unable to set offline in ZooKeeper to assign " + region);
1905           // Setting offline in ZK must have been failed due to ZK racing or some
1906           // exception which may make the server to abort. If it is ZK racing,
1907           // we should retry since we already reset the region state,
1908           // existing (re)assignment will fail anyway.
1909           if (!server.isAborted()) {
1910             continue;
1911           }
1912         }
1913         LOG.info("Assigning " + region.getRegionNameAsString() +
1914             " to " + plan.getDestination().toString());
1915         // Transition RegionState to PENDING_OPEN
1916         currentState = regionStates.updateRegionState(region,
1917           State.PENDING_OPEN, plan.getDestination());
1918 
1919         boolean needNewPlan;
1920         final String assignMsg = "Failed assignment of " + region.getRegionNameAsString() +
1921             " to " + plan.getDestination();
1922         try {
1923           List<ServerName> favoredNodes = ServerName.EMPTY_SERVER_LIST;
1924           if (this.shouldAssignRegionsWithFavoredNodes) {
1925             favoredNodes = ((FavoredNodeLoadBalancer)this.balancer).getFavoredNodes(region);
1926           }
1927           regionOpenState = serverManager.sendRegionOpen(
1928               plan.getDestination(), region, versionOfOfflineNode, favoredNodes);
1929 
1930           if (regionOpenState == RegionOpeningState.FAILED_OPENING) {
1931             // Failed opening this region, looping again on a new server.
1932             needNewPlan = true;
1933             LOG.warn(assignMsg + ", regionserver says 'FAILED_OPENING', " +
1934                 " trying to assign elsewhere instead; " +
1935                 "try=" + i + " of " + this.maximumAttempts);
1936           } else {
1937             // we're done
1938             if (regionOpenState == RegionOpeningState.ALREADY_OPENED) {
1939               processAlreadyOpenedRegion(region, plan.getDestination());
1940             }
1941             return;
1942           }
1943 
1944         } catch (Throwable t) {
1945           if (t instanceof RemoteException) {
1946             t = ((RemoteException) t).unwrapRemoteException();
1947           }
1948 
1949           // Should we wait a little before retrying? If the server is starting it's yes.
1950           // If the region is already in transition, it's yes as well: we want to be sure that
1951           //  the region will get opened but we don't want a double assignment.
1952           boolean hold = (t instanceof RegionAlreadyInTransitionException ||
1953               t instanceof ServerNotRunningYetException);
1954 
1955           // In case socket is timed out and the region server is still online,
1956           // the openRegion RPC could have been accepted by the server and
1957           // just the response didn't go through.  So we will retry to
1958           // open the region on the same server to avoid possible
1959           // double assignment.
1960           boolean retry = !hold && (t instanceof java.net.SocketTimeoutException
1961               && this.serverManager.isServerOnline(plan.getDestination()));
1962 
1963 
1964           if (hold) {
1965             LOG.warn(assignMsg + ", waiting a little before trying on the same region server " +
1966               "try=" + i + " of " + this.maximumAttempts, t);
1967 
1968             if (maxWaitTime < 0) {
1969               if (t instanceof RegionAlreadyInTransitionException) {
1970                 maxWaitTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()
1971                   + this.server.getConfiguration().getLong(ALREADY_IN_TRANSITION_WAITTIME,
1972                     DEFAULT_ALREADY_IN_TRANSITION_WAITTIME);
1973               } else {
1974                 maxWaitTime = this.server.getConfiguration().
1975                   getLong("hbase.regionserver.rpc.startup.waittime", 60000);
1976               }
1977             }
1978             try {
1979               needNewPlan = false;
1980               long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis();
1981               if (now < maxWaitTime) {
1982                 LOG.debug("Server is not yet up or region is already in transition; "
1983                   + "waiting up to " + (maxWaitTime - now) + "ms", t);
1984                 Thread.sleep(100);
1985                 i--; // reset the try count
1986               } else if (!(t instanceof RegionAlreadyInTransitionException)) {
1987                 LOG.debug("Server is not up for a while; try a new one", t);
1988                 needNewPlan = true;
1989               }
1990             } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1991               LOG.warn("Failed to assign "
1992                   + region.getRegionNameAsString() + " since interrupted", ie);
1993               Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1994               if (!tomActivated) {
1995                 regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_OPEN);
1996               }
1997               return;
1998             }
1999           } else if (retry) {
2000             needNewPlan = false;
2001             LOG.warn(assignMsg + ", trying to assign to the same region server " +
2002                 "try=" + i + " of " + this.maximumAttempts, t);
2003           } else {
2004             needNewPlan = true;
2005             LOG.warn(assignMsg + ", trying to assign elsewhere instead;" +
2006                 " try=" + i + " of " + this.maximumAttempts, t);
2007           }
2008         }
2009 
2010         if (i == this.maximumAttempts) {
2011           // Don't reset the region state or get a new plan any more.
2012           // This is the last try.
2013           continue;
2014         }
2015 
2016         // If region opened on destination of present plan, reassigning to new
2017         // RS may cause double assignments. In case of RegionAlreadyInTransitionException
2018         // reassigning to same RS.
2019         if (needNewPlan) {
2020           // Force a new plan and reassign. Will return null if no servers.
2021           // The new plan could be the same as the existing plan since we don't
2022           // exclude the server of the original plan, which should not be
2023           // excluded since it could be the only server up now.
2024           RegionPlan newPlan = null;
2025           try {
2026             newPlan = getRegionPlan(region, true);
2027           } catch (HBaseIOException e) {
2028             LOG.warn("Failed to get region plan", e);
2029           }
2030           if (newPlan == null) {
2031             if (tomActivated) {
2032               this.timeoutMonitor.setAllRegionServersOffline(true);
2033             } else {
2034               regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_OPEN);
2035             }
2036             LOG.warn("Unable to find a viable location to assign region " +
2037                 region.getRegionNameAsString());
2038             return;
2039           }
2040 
2041           if (plan != newPlan && !plan.getDestination().equals(newPlan.getDestination())) {
2042             // Clean out plan we failed execute and one that doesn't look like it'll
2043             // succeed anyways; we need a new plan!
2044             // Transition back to OFFLINE
2045             currentState = regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.OFFLINE);
2046             versionOfOfflineNode = -1;
2047             plan = newPlan;
2048           }
2049         }
2050       }
2051       // Run out of attempts
2052       if (!tomActivated) {
2053         regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.FAILED_OPEN);
2054       }
2055     } finally {
2056       metricsAssignmentManager.updateAssignmentTime(EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() - startTime);
2057     }
2058   }
2059 
2060   private void processAlreadyOpenedRegion(HRegionInfo region, ServerName sn) {
2061     // Remove region from in-memory transition and unassigned node from ZK
2062     // While trying to enable the table the regions of the table were
2063     // already enabled.
2064     LOG.debug("ALREADY_OPENED " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
2065       + " to " + sn);
2066     String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
2067     deleteNodeInStates(encodedName, "offline", sn, EventType.M_ZK_REGION_OFFLINE);
2068     regionStates.regionOnline(region, sn);
2069   }
