2071   private boolean isDisabledorDisablingRegionInRIT(final HRegionInfo region) {
2072     TableName tableName = region.getTable();
2073     boolean disabled = this.zkTable.isDisabledTable(tableName);
2074     if (disabled || this.zkTable.isDisablingTable(tableName)) {
2075       LOG.info("Table " + tableName + (disabled ? " disabled;" : " disabling;") +
2076         " skipping assign of " + region.getRegionNameAsString());
2077       offlineDisabledRegion(region);
2078       return true;
2079     }
2080     return false;
2081   }

2083   /**
2084    * Set region as OFFLINED up in zookeeper
2085    *
2086    * @param state
2087    * @return the version of the offline node if setting of the OFFLINE node was
2088    *         successful, -1 otherwise.
2089    */
2090   private int setOfflineInZooKeeper(final RegionState state, final ServerName destination) {
2091     if (!state.isClosed() && !state.isOffline()) {
2092       String msg = "Unexpected state : " + state + " .. Cannot transit it to OFFLINE.";
2093       this.server.abort(msg, new IllegalStateException(msg));
2094       return -1;
2095     }
2096     regionStates.updateRegionState(state.getRegion(), State.OFFLINE);
2097     int versionOfOfflineNode;
2098     try {
2099       // get the version after setting the znode to OFFLINE
2100       versionOfOfflineNode = ZKAssign.createOrForceNodeOffline(watcher,
2101         state.getRegion(), destination);
2102       if (versionOfOfflineNode == -1) {
2103         LOG.warn("Attempted to create/force node into OFFLINE state before "
2104             + "completing assignment but failed to do so for " + state);
2105         return -1;
2106       }
2107     } catch (KeeperException e) {
2108       server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception creating/setting node OFFLINE", e);
2109       return -1;
2110     }
2111     return versionOfOfflineNode;
2112   }

2115    * @param region the region to assign
2116    * @return Plan for passed <code>region</code> (If none currently, it creates one or
2117    * if no servers to assign, it returns null).
2118    */
2119   private RegionPlan getRegionPlan(final HRegionInfo region,
2120       final boolean forceNewPlan)  throws HBaseIOException  {
2121     return getRegionPlan(region, null, forceNewPlan);
2122   }

2124   /**
2125    * @param region the region to assign
2126    * @param serverToExclude Server to exclude (we know its bad). Pass null if
2127    * all servers are thought to be assignable.
2128    * @param forceNewPlan If true, then if an existing plan exists, a new plan
2129    * will be generated.
2130    * @return Plan for passed <code>region</code> (If none currently, it creates one or
2131    * if no servers to assign, it returns null).
2132    */
2133   private RegionPlan getRegionPlan(final HRegionInfo region,
2134       final ServerName serverToExclude, final boolean forceNewPlan) throws HBaseIOException {
2135     // Pickup existing plan or make a new one
2136     final String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
2137     final List<ServerName> destServers =
2138       serverManager.createDestinationServersList(serverToExclude);
2139 
2140     if (destServers.isEmpty()){
2141       LOG.warn("Can't move " + encodedName +
2142         ", there is no destination server available.");
2143       return null;
2144     }
2145 
2146     RegionPlan randomPlan = null;
2147     boolean newPlan = false;
2148     RegionPlan existingPlan;
2149 
2150     synchronized (this.regionPlans) {
2151       existingPlan = this.regionPlans.get(encodedName);
2152 
2153       if (existingPlan != null && existingPlan.getDestination() != null) {
2154         LOG.debug("Found an existing plan for " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
2155           + " destination server is " + existingPlan.getDestination() +
2156             " accepted as a dest server = " + destServers.contains(existingPlan.getDestination()));
2157       }
2158 
2159       if (forceNewPlan
2160           || existingPlan == null
2161           || existingPlan.getDestination() == null
2162           || !destServers.contains(existingPlan.getDestination())) {
2163         newPlan = true;
2164         randomPlan = new RegionPlan(region, null,
2165             balancer.randomAssignment(region, destServers));
2166         if (!region.isMetaTable() && shouldAssignRegionsWithFavoredNodes) {
2167           List<HRegionInfo> regions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>(1);
2168           regions.add(region);
2169           try {
2170             processFavoredNodes(regions);
2171           } catch (IOException ie) {
2172             LOG.warn("Ignoring exception in processFavoredNodes " + ie);
2173           }
2174         }
2175         this.regionPlans.put(encodedName, randomPlan);
2176       }
2177     }
2178 
2179     if (newPlan) {
2180       if (randomPlan.getDestination() == null) {
2181         LOG.warn("Can't find a destination for " + encodedName);
2182         return null;
2183       }
2184       LOG.debug("No previous transition plan found (or ignoring " +
2185         "an existing plan) for " + region.getRegionNameAsString() +
2186         "; generated random plan=" + randomPlan + "; " +
2187         serverManager.countOfRegionServers() +
2188                " (online=" + serverManager.getOnlineServers().size() +
2189                ", available=" + destServers.size() + ") available servers" +
2190                ", forceNewPlan=" + forceNewPlan);
2191         return randomPlan;
2192       }
2193     LOG.debug("Using pre-existing plan for " +
2194       region.getRegionNameAsString() + "; plan=" + existingPlan);
2195     return existingPlan;
2196   }

2198   /**
2199    * Unassigns the specified region.
2200    * <p>
2201    * Updates the RegionState and sends the CLOSE RPC unless region is being
2202    * split by regionserver; then the unassign fails (silently) because we
2203    * presume the region being unassigned no longer exists (its been split out
2204    * of existence). TODO: What to do if split fails and is rolled back and
2205    * parent is revivified?
2206    * <p>
2207    * If a RegionPlan is already set, it will remain.
2208    *
2209    * @param region server to be unassigned
2210    */
2211   public void unassign(HRegionInfo region) {
2212     unassign(region, false);
2213   }

2216   /**
2217    * Unassigns the specified region.
2218    * <p>
2219    * Updates the RegionState and sends the CLOSE RPC unless region is being
2220    * split by regionserver; then the unassign fails (silently) because we
2221    * presume the region being unassigned no longer exists (its been split out
2222    * of existence). TODO: What to do if split fails and is rolled back and
2223    * parent is revivified?
2224    * <p>
2225    * If a RegionPlan is already set, it will remain.
2226    *
2227    * @param region server to be unassigned
2228    * @param force if region should be closed even if already closing
2229    */
2230   public void unassign(HRegionInfo region, boolean force, ServerName dest) {
2231     // TODO: Method needs refactoring.  Ugly buried returns throughout.  Beware!
2232     LOG.debug("Starting unassign of " + region.getRegionNameAsString()
2233       + " (offlining), current state: " + regionStates.getRegionState(region));
2234 
2235     String encodedName = region.getEncodedName();
2236     // Grab the state of this region and synchronize on it
2237     int versionOfClosingNode = -1;
2238     // We need a lock here as we're going to do a put later and we don't want multiple states
2239     //  creation
2240     ReentrantLock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedName);
2241     RegionState state = regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(encodedName);
2242     boolean reassign = true;
2243     try {
2244       if (state == null) {
2245         // Region is not in transition.
2246         // We can unassign it only if it's not SPLIT/MERGED.
2247         state = regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName);
2248         if (state != null && state.isUnassignable()) {
2249           LOG.info("Attempting to unassign " + state + ", ignored");
2250           // Offline region will be reassigned below
2251           return;
2252         }
2253         // Create the znode in CLOSING state
2254         try {
2255           if (state == null || state.getServerName() == null) {
2256             // We don't know where the region is, offline it.
2257             // No need to send CLOSE RPC
2258             LOG.warn("Attempting to unassign a region not in RegionStates"
2259               + region.getRegionNameAsString() + ", offlined");
2260             regionOffline(region);
2261             return;
2262           }
2263           versionOfClosingNode = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(
2264             watcher, region, state.getServerName());
2265           if (versionOfClosingNode == -1) {
2266             LOG.info("Attempting to unassign " +
2267               region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but ZK closing node "
2268               + "can't be created.");
2269             reassign = false; // not unassigned at all
2270             return;
2271           }
2272         } catch (KeeperException e) {
2273           if (e instanceof NodeExistsException) {
2274             // Handle race between master initiated close and regionserver
2275             // orchestrated splitting. See if existing node is in a
2276             // SPLITTING or SPLIT state.  If so, the regionserver started
2277             // an op on node before we could get our CLOSING in.  Deal.
2278             NodeExistsException nee = (NodeExistsException)e;
2279             String path = nee.getPath();
2280             try {
2281               if (isSplitOrSplittingOrMergedOrMerging(path)) {
2282                 LOG.debug(path + " is SPLIT or SPLITTING or MERGED or MERGING; " +
2283                   "skipping unassign because region no longer exists -- its split or merge");
2284                 reassign = false; // no need to reassign for split/merged region
2285                 return;
2286               }
2287             } catch (KeeperException.NoNodeException ke) {
2288               LOG.warn("Failed getData on SPLITTING/SPLIT at " + path +
2289                 "; presuming split and that the region to unassign, " +
2290                 encodedName + ", no longer exists -- confirm", ke);
2291               return;
2292             } catch (KeeperException ke) {
2293               LOG.error("Unexpected zk state", ke);
2294             } catch (DeserializationException de) {
2295               LOG.error("Failed parse", de);
2296             }
2297           }
2298           // If we get here, don't understand whats going on -- abort.
2299           server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception creating node CLOSING", e);
2300           reassign = false; // heading out already
2301           return;
2302         }
2303         state = regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.PENDING_CLOSE);
2304       } else if (state.isFailedOpen()) {
2305         // The region is not open yet
2306         regionOffline(region);
2307         return;
2308       } else if (force && state.isPendingCloseOrClosing()) {
2309         LOG.debug("Attempting to unassign " + region.getRegionNameAsString() +
2310           " which is already " + state.getState()  +
2311           " but forcing to send a CLOSE RPC again ");
2312         if (state.isFailedClose()) {
2313           state = regionStates.updateRegionState(region, State.PENDING_CLOSE);
2314         }
2315         state.updateTimestampToNow();
2316       } else {
2317         LOG.debug("Attempting to unassign " +
2318           region.getRegionNameAsString() + " but it is " +
2319           "already in transition (" + state.getState() + ", force=" + force + ")");
2320         return;
2321       }
2322 
2323       unassign(region, state, versionOfClosingNode, dest, true, null);
2324     } finally {
2325       lock.unlock();
2326 
2327       // Region is expected to be reassigned afterwards
2328       if (reassign && regionStates.isRegionOffline(region)) {
2329         assign(region, true);
2330       }
2331     }
2332   }

2335      unassign(region, force, null);
2336   }

2347   /**
2348    * @param path
2349    * @return True if znode is in SPLIT or SPLITTING or MERGED or MERGING state.
2350    * @throws KeeperException Can happen if the znode went away in meantime.
2351    * @throws DeserializationException
2352    */
2353   private boolean isSplitOrSplittingOrMergedOrMerging(final String path)
2354       throws KeeperException, DeserializationException {
2355     boolean result = false;
2356     // This may fail if the SPLIT or SPLITTING or MERGED or MERGING znode gets
2357     // cleaned up before we can get data from it.
2358     byte [] data = ZKAssign.getData(watcher, path);
2359     if (data == null) {
2360       LOG.info("Node " + path + " is gone");
2361       return false;
2362     }
2363     RegionTransition rt = RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
2364     switch (rt.getEventType()) {
2365     case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_SPLIT:
2366     case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLIT:
2367     case RS_ZK_REGION_SPLITTING:
2368     case RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE:
2369     case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED:
2370     case RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING:
2371       result = true;
2372       break;
2373     default:
2374       LOG.info("Node " + path + " is in " + rt.getEventType());
2375       break;
2376     }
2377     return result;
2378   }

2389   /**
2390    * Waits until the specified region has completed assignment.
2391    * <p>
2392    * If the region is already assigned, returns immediately.  Otherwise, method
2393    * blocks until the region is assigned.
2394    * @param regionInfo region to wait on assignment for
2395    * @throws InterruptedException
2396    */
2397   public boolean waitForAssignment(HRegionInfo regionInfo)
2398       throws InterruptedException {
2399     while (!regionStates.isRegionOnline(regionInfo)) {
2400       if (regionStates.isRegionInState(regionInfo, State.FAILED_OPEN)
2401           || this.server.isStopped()) {
2402         return false;
2403       }
2404 
2405       // We should receive a notification, but it's
2406       //  better to have a timeout to recheck the condition here:
2407       //  it lowers the impact of a race condition if any
2408       regionStates.waitForUpdate(100);
2409     }
2410     return true;
2411   }

2413   /**
2414    * Assigns the hbase:meta region.
2415    * <p>
2416    * Assumes that hbase:meta is currently closed and is not being actively served by
2417    * any RegionServer.
2418    * <p>
2419    * Forcibly unsets the current meta region location in ZooKeeper and assigns
2420    * hbase:meta to a random RegionServer.
2421    * @throws KeeperException
2422    */
2423   public void assignMeta() throws KeeperException {
2424     MetaRegionTracker.deleteMetaLocation(this.watcher);
2425     assign(HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO, true);
2426   }
2427 
2428   /**
2429    * Assigns specified regions retaining assignments, if any.
2430    * <p>
2431    * This is a synchronous call and will return once every region has been
2432    * assigned.  If anything fails, an exception is thrown
2433    * @throws InterruptedException
2434    * @throws IOException
2435    */
2436   public void assign(Map<HRegionInfo, ServerName> regions)
2437         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
2438     if (regions == null || regions.isEmpty()) {
2439       return;
2440     }
2441     List<ServerName> servers = serverManager.createDestinationServersList();
2442     if (servers == null || servers.isEmpty()) {
2443       throw new IOException("Found no destination server to assign region(s)");
2444     }
2445 
2446     // Reuse existing assignment info
2447     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan =
2448       balancer.retainAssignment(regions, servers);
2449 
2450     assign(regions.size(), servers.size(),
2451       "retainAssignment=true", bulkPlan);
2452   }
2453 
2454   /**
2455    * Assigns specified regions round robin, if any.
2456    * <p>
2457    * This is a synchronous call and will return once every region has been
2458    * assigned.  If anything fails, an exception is thrown
2459    * @throws InterruptedException
2460    * @throws IOException
2461    */
2462   public void assign(List<HRegionInfo> regions)
2463         throws IOException, InterruptedException {
2464     if (regions == null || regions.isEmpty()) {
2465       return;
2466     }
2467 
2468     List<ServerName> servers = serverManager.createDestinationServersList();
2469     if (servers == null || servers.isEmpty()) {
2470       throw new IOException("Found no destination server to assign region(s)");
2471     }
2472 
2473     // Generate a round-robin bulk assignment plan
2474     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan
2475       = balancer.roundRobinAssignment(regions, servers);
2476     processFavoredNodes(regions);
2477 
2478     assign(regions.size(), servers.size(),
2479       "round-robin=true", bulkPlan);
2480   }
2481 
2482   private void assign(int regions, int totalServers,
2483       String message, Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> bulkPlan)
2484           throws InterruptedException, IOException {
2485 
2486     int servers = bulkPlan.size();
2487     if (servers == 1 || (regions < bulkAssignThresholdRegions
2488         && servers < bulkAssignThresholdServers)) {
2489 
2490       // Not use bulk assignment.  This could be more efficient in small
2491       // cluster, especially mini cluster for testing, so that tests won't time out
2492       if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
2493         LOG.trace("Not using bulk assignment since we are assigning only " + regions +
2494           " region(s) to " + servers + " server(s)");
2495       }
2496       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> plan: bulkPlan.entrySet()) {
2497         if (!assign(plan.getKey(), plan.getValue())) {
2498           for (HRegionInfo region: plan.getValue()) {
2499             if (!regionStates.isRegionOnline(region)) {
2500               invokeAssign(region);
2501             }
2502           }
2503         }
2504       }
2505     } else {
2506       LOG.info("Bulk assigning " + regions + " region(s) across "
2507         + totalServers + " server(s), " + message);
2508 
2509       // Use fixed count thread pool assigning.
2510       BulkAssigner ba = new GeneralBulkAssigner(
2511         this.server, bulkPlan, this, bulkAssignWaitTillAllAssigned);
2512       ba.bulkAssign();
2513       LOG.info("Bulk assigning done");
2514     }
2515   }
2516 
2517   /**
2518    * Assigns all user regions, if any exist.  Used during cluster startup.
2519    * <p>
2520    * This is a synchronous call and will return once every region has been
2521    * assigned.  If anything fails, an exception is thrown and the cluster
2522    * should be shutdown.
2523    * @throws InterruptedException
2524    * @throws IOException
2525    * @throws KeeperException
2526    */
2527   private void assignAllUserRegions()
2528       throws IOException, InterruptedException, KeeperException {
2529     // Cleanup any existing ZK nodes and start watching
2530     ZKAssign.deleteAllNodes(watcher);
2531     ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(this.watcher,
2532       this.watcher.assignmentZNode);
2533     failoverCleanupDone();
2534 
2535     // Skip assignment for regions of tables in DISABLING state because during clean cluster startup
2536     // no RS is alive and regions map also doesn't have any information about the regions.
2537     // See HBASE-6281.
2538     Set<TableName> disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling = ZKTable.getDisabledOrDisablingTables(watcher);
2539     disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling.addAll(ZKTable.getEnablingTables(watcher));
2540     // Scan hbase:meta for all user regions, skipping any disabled tables
2541     Map<HRegionInfo, ServerName> allRegions;
2542     SnapshotOfRegionAssignmentFromMeta snapshotOfRegionAssignment =
2543        new SnapshotOfRegionAssignmentFromMeta(catalogTracker, disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling, true);
2544     snapshotOfRegionAssignment.initialize();
2545     allRegions = snapshotOfRegionAssignment.getRegionToRegionServerMap();
2546     if (allRegions == null || allRegions.isEmpty()) return;
2547 
2548     // Determine what type of assignment to do on startup
2549     boolean retainAssignment = server.getConfiguration().
2550       getBoolean("hbase.master.startup.retainassign", true);
2551 
2552     if (retainAssignment) {
2553       assign(allRegions);
2554     } else {
2555       List<HRegionInfo> regions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>(allRegions.keySet());
2556       assign(regions);
2557     }
2558 
2559     for (HRegionInfo hri : allRegions.keySet()) {
2560       TableName tableName = hri.getTable();
2561       if (!zkTable.isEnabledTable(tableName)) {
2562         setEnabledTable(tableName);
2563       }
2564     }
2565   }
2566 
2567   /**
2568    * Wait until no regions in transition.
2569    * @param timeout How long to wait.
2570    * @return True if nothing in regions in transition.
2571    * @throws InterruptedException
2572    */
2573   boolean waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(final long timeout)
2574       throws InterruptedException {
2575     // Blocks until there are no regions in transition. It is possible that
2576     // there
2577     // are regions in transition immediately after this returns but guarantees
2578     // that if it returns without an exception that there was a period of time
2579     // with no regions in transition from the point-of-view of the in-memory
2580     // state of the Master.
2581     final long endTime = System.currentTimeMillis() + timeout;
2582 
2583     while (!this.server.isStopped() && regionStates.isRegionsInTransition()
2584         && endTime > System.currentTimeMillis()) {
2585       regionStates.waitForUpdate(100);
2586     }
2587 
2588     return !regionStates.isRegionsInTransition();
2589   }
2590 
2591   /**
2592    * Rebuild the list of user regions and assignment information.
2593    * <p>
2594    * Returns a map of servers that are not found to be online and the regions
2595    * they were hosting.
2596    * @return map of servers not online to their assigned regions, as stored
2597    *         in META
2598    * @throws IOException
2599    */
2600   Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> rebuildUserRegions() throws IOException, KeeperException {
2601     Set<TableName> enablingTables = ZKTable.getEnablingTables(watcher);
2602     Set<TableName> disabledOrEnablingTables = ZKTable.getDisabledTables(watcher);
2603     disabledOrEnablingTables.addAll(enablingTables);
2604     Set<TableName> disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling = ZKTable.getDisablingTables(watcher);
2605     disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling.addAll(disabledOrEnablingTables);
2606 
2607     // Region assignment from META
2608     List<Result> results = MetaReader.fullScan(this.catalogTracker);
2609     // Get any new but slow to checkin region server that joined the cluster
2610     Set<ServerName> onlineServers = serverManager.getOnlineServers().keySet();
2611     // Map of offline servers and their regions to be returned
2612     Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> offlineServers =
2613       new TreeMap<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>>();
2614     // Iterate regions in META
2615     for (Result result : results) {
2616       Pair<HRegionInfo, ServerName> region = HRegionInfo.getHRegionInfoAndServerName(result);
2617       if (region == null) continue;
2618       HRegionInfo regionInfo = region.getFirst();
2619       ServerName regionLocation = region.getSecond();
2620       if (regionInfo == null) continue;
2621       regionStates.createRegionState(regionInfo);
2622       if (regionStates.isRegionInState(regionInfo, State.SPLIT)) {
2623         // Split is considered to be completed. If the split znode still
2624         // exists, the region will be put back to SPLITTING state later
2625         LOG.debug("Region " + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString()
2626            + " split is completed. Hence need not add to regions list");
2627         continue;
2628       }
2629       TableName tableName = regionInfo.getTable();
2630       if (regionLocation == null) {
2631         // regionLocation could be null if createTable didn't finish properly.
2632         // When createTable is in progress, HMaster restarts.
2633         // Some regions have been added to hbase:meta, but have not been assigned.
2634         // When this happens, the region's table must be in ENABLING state.
2635         // It can't be in ENABLED state as that is set when all regions are
2636         // assigned.
2637         // It can't be in DISABLING state, because DISABLING state transitions
2638         // from ENABLED state when application calls disableTable.
2639         // It can't be in DISABLED state, because DISABLED states transitions
2640         // from DISABLING state.
2641         if (!enablingTables.contains(tableName)) {
2642           LOG.warn("Region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName() +
2643             " has null regionLocation." + " But its table " + tableName +
2644             " isn't in ENABLING state.");
2645         }
2646       } else if (!onlineServers.contains(regionLocation)) {
2647         // Region is located on a server that isn't online
2648         List<HRegionInfo> offlineRegions = offlineServers.get(regionLocation);
2649         if (offlineRegions == null) {
2650           offlineRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>(1);
2651           offlineServers.put(regionLocation, offlineRegions);
2652         }
2653         offlineRegions.add(regionInfo);
2654         // need to enable the table if not disabled or disabling or enabling
2655         // this will be used in rolling restarts
2656         if (!disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling.contains(tableName)
2657             && !getZKTable().isEnabledTable(tableName)) {
2658           setEnabledTable(tableName);
2659         }
2660       } else {
2661         // Region is being served and on an active server
2662         // add only if region not in disabled or enabling table
2663         if (!disabledOrEnablingTables.contains(tableName)) {
2664           regionStates.updateRegionState(regionInfo, State.OPEN, regionLocation);
2665           regionStates.regionOnline(regionInfo, regionLocation);
2666         }
2667         // need to enable the table if not disabled or disabling or enabling
2668         // this will be used in rolling restarts
2669         if (!disabledOrDisablingOrEnabling.contains(tableName)
2670             && !getZKTable().isEnabledTable(tableName)) {
2671           setEnabledTable(tableName);
2672         }
2673       }
2674     }
2675     return offlineServers;
2676   }
2677 
2678   /**
2679    * Recover the tables that were not fully moved to DISABLED state. These
2680    * tables are in DISABLING state when the master restarted/switched.
2681    *
2682    * @throws KeeperException
2683    * @throws TableNotFoundException
2684    * @throws IOException
2685    */
2686   private void recoverTableInDisablingState()
2687       throws KeeperException, TableNotFoundException, IOException {
2688     Set<TableName> disablingTables = ZKTable.getDisablingTables(watcher);
2689     if (disablingTables.size() != 0) {
2690       for (TableName tableName : disablingTables) {
2691         // Recover by calling DisableTableHandler
2692         LOG.info("The table " + tableName
2693             + " is in DISABLING state.  Hence recovering by moving the table"
2694             + " to DISABLED state.");
2695         new DisableTableHandler(this.server, tableName, catalogTracker,
2696             this, tableLockManager, true).prepare().process();
2697       }
2698     }
2699   }
2700 
2701   /**
2702    * Recover the tables that are not fully moved to ENABLED state. These tables
2703    * are in ENABLING state when the master restarted/switched
2704    *
2705    * @throws KeeperException
2706    * @throws org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TableNotFoundException
2707    * @throws IOException
2708    */
2709   private void recoverTableInEnablingState()
2710       throws KeeperException, TableNotFoundException, IOException {
2711     Set<TableName> enablingTables = ZKTable.getEnablingTables(watcher);
2712     if (enablingTables.size() != 0) {
2713       for (TableName tableName : enablingTables) {
2714         // Recover by calling EnableTableHandler
2715         LOG.info("The table " + tableName
2716             + " is in ENABLING state.  Hence recovering by moving the table"
2717             + " to ENABLED state.");
2718         // enableTable in sync way during master startup,
2719         // no need to invoke coprocessor
2720         new EnableTableHandler(this.server, tableName,
2721             catalogTracker, this, tableLockManager, true).prepare().process();
2722       }
2723     }
2724   }

2726   /**
2727    * Processes list of dead servers from result of hbase:meta scan and regions in RIT
2728    * <p>
2729    * This is used for failover to recover the lost regions that belonged to
2730    * RegionServers which failed while there was no active master or regions
2731    * that were in RIT.
2732    * <p>
2733    *
2734    *
2735    * @param deadServers
2736    *          The list of dead servers which failed while there was no active
2737    *          master. Can be null.
2738    * @throws IOException
2739    * @throws KeeperException
2740    */
2741   private void processDeadServersAndRecoverLostRegions(
2742       Map<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> deadServers)
2743           throws IOException, KeeperException {
2744     if (deadServers != null) {
2745       for (Map.Entry<ServerName, List<HRegionInfo>> server: deadServers.entrySet()) {
2746         ServerName serverName = server.getKey();
2747         // We need to keep such info even if the server is known dead
2748         regionStates.setLastRegionServerOfRegions(serverName, server.getValue());
2749         if (!serverManager.isServerDead(serverName)) {
2750           serverManager.expireServer(serverName); // Let SSH do region re-assign
2751         }
2752       }
2753     }
2754     List<String> nodes = ZKUtil.listChildrenAndWatchForNewChildren(
2755       this.watcher, this.watcher.assignmentZNode);
2756     if (!nodes.isEmpty()) {
2757       for (String encodedRegionName : nodes) {
2758         processRegionInTransition(encodedRegionName, null);
2759       }
2760     }
2761 
2762     // Now we can safely claim failover cleanup completed and enable
2763     // ServerShutdownHandler for further processing. The nodes (below)
2764     // in transition, if any, are for regions not related to those
2765     // dead servers at all, and can be done in parallel to SSH.
2766     failoverCleanupDone();
2767   }

2769   /**
2770    * Set Regions in transitions metrics.
2771    * This takes an iterator on the RegionInTransition map (CLSM), and is not synchronized.
2772    * This iterator is not fail fast, which may lead to stale read; but that's better than
2773    * creating a copy of the map for metrics computation, as this method will be invoked
2774    * on a frequent interval.
2775    */
2776   public void updateRegionsInTransitionMetrics() {
2777     long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
2778     int totalRITs = 0;
2779     int totalRITsOverThreshold = 0;
2780     long oldestRITTime = 0;
2781     int ritThreshold = this.server.getConfiguration().
2782       getInt(HConstants.METRICS_RIT_STUCK_WARNING_THRESHOLD, 60000);
2783     for (RegionState state: regionStates.getRegionsInTransition().values()) {
2784       totalRITs++;
2785       long ritTime = currentTime - state.getStamp();
2786       if (ritTime > ritThreshold) { // more than the threshold
2787         totalRITsOverThreshold++;
2788       }
2789       if (oldestRITTime < ritTime) {
2790         oldestRITTime = ritTime;
2791       }
2792     }
2793     if (this.metricsAssignmentManager != null) {
2794       this.metricsAssignmentManager.updateRITOldestAge(oldestRITTime);
2795       this.metricsAssignmentManager.updateRITCount(totalRITs);
2796       this.metricsAssignmentManager.updateRITCountOverThreshold(totalRITsOverThreshold);
2797     }
2798   }

2802    */

2809   /**
2810    * Wait on region to clear regions-in-transition.
2811    * @param hri Region to wait on.
2812    * @throws IOException
2813    */
2814   public void waitOnRegionToClearRegionsInTransition(final HRegionInfo hri)
2815       throws IOException, InterruptedException {
2816     waitOnRegionToClearRegionsInTransition(hri, -1L);
2817   }
2818 
2819   /**
2820    * Wait on region to clear regions-in-transition or time out
2821    * @param hri
2822    * @param timeOut Milliseconds to wait for current region to be out of transition state.
2823    * @return True when a region clears regions-in-transition before timeout otherwise false
2824    * @throws InterruptedException
2825    */
2826   public boolean waitOnRegionToClearRegionsInTransition(final HRegionInfo hri, long timeOut)
2827       throws InterruptedException {
2828     if (!regionStates.isRegionInTransition(hri)) return true;
2829     long end = (timeOut <= 0) ? Long.MAX_VALUE : EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis()
2830         + timeOut;
2831     // There is already a timeout monitor on regions in transition so I
2832     // should not have to have one here too?
2833     LOG.info("Waiting for " + hri.getEncodedName() +
2834         " to leave regions-in-transition, timeOut=" + timeOut + " ms.");
2835     while (!this.server.isStopped() && regionStates.isRegionInTransition(hri)) {
2836       regionStates.waitForUpdate(100);
2837       if (EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis() > end) {
2838         LOG.info("Timed out on waiting for " + hri.getEncodedName() + " to be assigned.");
2839         return false;
2840       }
2841     }
2842     if (this.server.isStopped()) {
2843       LOG.info("Giving up wait on regions in transition because stoppable.isStopped is set");
2844       return false;
2845     }
2846     return true;
2847   }

2849   /**
2850    * Update timers for all regions in transition going against the server in the
2851    * serversInUpdatingTimer.
2852    */
2853   public class TimerUpdater extends Chore {
2854 
2855     public TimerUpdater(final int period, final Stoppable stopper) {
2856       super("AssignmentTimerUpdater", period, stopper);
2857     }
2858 
2859     @Override
2860     protected void chore() {
2861       Preconditions.checkState(tomActivated);
2862       ServerName serverToUpdateTimer = null;
2863       while (!serversInUpdatingTimer.isEmpty() && !stopper.isStopped()) {
2864         if (serverToUpdateTimer == null) {
2865           serverToUpdateTimer = serversInUpdatingTimer.first();
2866         } else {
2867           serverToUpdateTimer = serversInUpdatingTimer
2868               .higher(serverToUpdateTimer);
2869         }
2870         if (serverToUpdateTimer == null) {
2871           break;
2872         }
2873         updateTimers(serverToUpdateTimer);
2874         serversInUpdatingTimer.remove(serverToUpdateTimer);
2875       }
2876     }
2877   }
2878 
2879   /**
2880    * Monitor to check for time outs on region transition operations
2881    */
2882   public class TimeoutMonitor extends Chore {
2883     private boolean allRegionServersOffline = false;
2884     private ServerManager serverManager;
2885     private final int timeout;
2886 
2887     /**
2888      * Creates a periodic monitor to check for time outs on region transition
2889      * operations.  This will deal with retries if for some reason something
2890      * doesn't happen within the specified timeout.
2891      * @param period
2892    * @param stopper When {@link Stoppable#isStopped()} is true, this thread will
2893    * cleanup and exit cleanly.
2894      * @param timeout
2895      */
2896     public TimeoutMonitor(final int period, final Stoppable stopper,
2897         ServerManager serverManager,
2898         final int timeout) {
2899       super("AssignmentTimeoutMonitor", period, stopper);
2900       this.timeout = timeout;
2901       this.serverManager = serverManager;
2902     }
2903 
2904     private synchronized void setAllRegionServersOffline(
2905       boolean allRegionServersOffline) {
2906       this.allRegionServersOffline = allRegionServersOffline;
2907     }
2908 
2909     @Override
2910     protected void chore() {
2911       Preconditions.checkState(tomActivated);
2912       boolean noRSAvailable = this.serverManager.createDestinationServersList().isEmpty();
2913 
2914       // Iterate all regions in transition checking for time outs
2915       long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
2916       // no lock concurrent access ok: we will be working on a copy, and it's java-valid to do
2917       //  a copy while another thread is adding/removing items
2918       for (String regionName : regionStates.getRegionsInTransition().keySet()) {
2919         RegionState regionState = regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(regionName);
2920         if (regionState == null) continue;
2921 
2922         if (regionState.getStamp() + timeout <= now) {
2923           // decide on action upon timeout
2924           actOnTimeOut(regionState);
2925         } else if (this.allRegionServersOffline && !noRSAvailable) {
2926           RegionPlan existingPlan = regionPlans.get(regionName);
2927           if (existingPlan == null
2928               || !this.serverManager.isServerOnline(existingPlan
2929                   .getDestination())) {
2930             // if some RSs just came back online, we can start the assignment
2931             // right away
2932             actOnTimeOut(regionState);
2933           }
2934         }
2935       }
2936       setAllRegionServersOffline(noRSAvailable);
2937     }
2938 
2939     private void actOnTimeOut(RegionState regionState) {
2940       HRegionInfo regionInfo = regionState.getRegion();
2941       LOG.info("Regions in transition timed out:  " + regionState);
2942       // Expired! Do a retry.
2943       switch (regionState.getState()) {
2944       case CLOSED:
2945         LOG.info("Region " + regionInfo.getEncodedName()
2946             + " has been CLOSED for too long, waiting on queued "
2947             + "ClosedRegionHandler to run or server shutdown");
2948         // Update our timestamp.
2949         regionState.updateTimestampToNow();
2950         break;
2951       case OFFLINE:
2952         LOG.info("Region has been OFFLINE for too long, " + "reassigning "
2953             + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString() + " to a random server");
2954         invokeAssign(regionInfo);
2955         break;
2956       case PENDING_OPEN:
2957         LOG.info("Region has been PENDING_OPEN for too "
2958             + "long, reassigning region=" + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
2959         invokeAssign(regionInfo);
2960         break;
2961       case OPENING:
2962         processOpeningState(regionInfo);
2963         break;
2964       case OPEN:
2965         LOG.error("Region has been OPEN for too long, " +
2966             "we don't know where region was opened so can't do anything");
2967         regionState.updateTimestampToNow();
2968         break;
2969 
2970       case PENDING_CLOSE:
2971         LOG.info("Region has been PENDING_CLOSE for too "
2972             + "long, running forced unassign again on region="
2973             + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
2974         invokeUnassign(regionInfo);
2975         break;
2976       case CLOSING:
2977         LOG.info("Region has been CLOSING for too " +
2978           "long, this should eventually complete or the server will " +
2979           "expire, send RPC again");
2980         invokeUnassign(regionInfo);
2981         break;
2982 
2983       case SPLIT:
2984       case SPLITTING:
2985       case FAILED_OPEN:
2986       case FAILED_CLOSE:
2987       case MERGING:
2988         break;
2989 
2990       default:
2991         throw new IllegalStateException("Received event is not valid.");
2992       }
2993     }
2994   }
2995 
2996   private void processOpeningState(HRegionInfo regionInfo) {
2997     LOG.info("Region has been OPENING for too long, reassigning region="
2998         + regionInfo.getRegionNameAsString());
2999     // Should have a ZK node in OPENING state
3000     try {
3001       String node = ZKAssign.getNodeName(watcher, regionInfo.getEncodedName());
3002       Stat stat = new Stat();
3003       byte [] data = ZKAssign.getDataNoWatch(watcher, node, stat);
3004       if (data == null) {
3005         LOG.warn("Data is null, node " + node + " no longer exists");
3006         return;
3007       }
3008       RegionTransition rt = RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
3009       EventType et = rt.getEventType();
3010       if (et == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
3011         LOG.debug("Region has transitioned to OPENED, allowing "
3012             + "watched event handlers to process");
3013         return;
3014       } else if (et != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENING && et != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN ) {
3015         LOG.warn("While timing out a region, found ZK node in unexpected state: " + et);
3016         return;
3017       }
3018       invokeAssign(regionInfo);
3019     } catch (KeeperException ke) {
3020       LOG.error("Unexpected ZK exception timing out CLOSING region", ke);
3021     } catch (DeserializationException e) {
3022       LOG.error("Unexpected exception parsing CLOSING region", e);
3023     }
3024   }

3038   /**
3039    * Check if the shutdown server carries the specific region.
3040    * We have a bunch of places that store region location
3041    * Those values aren't consistent. There is a delay of notification.
3042    * The location from zookeeper unassigned node has the most recent data;
3043    * but the node could be deleted after the region is opened by AM.
3044    * The AM's info could be old when OpenedRegionHandler
3045    * processing hasn't finished yet when server shutdown occurs.
3046    * @return whether the serverName currently hosts the region
3047    */
3048   private boolean isCarryingRegion(ServerName serverName, HRegionInfo hri) {
3049     RegionTransition rt = null;
3050     try {
3051       byte [] data = ZKAssign.getData(watcher, hri.getEncodedName());
3052       // This call can legitimately come by null
3053       rt = data == null? null: RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
3054     } catch (KeeperException e) {
3055       server.abort("Exception reading unassigned node for region=" + hri.getEncodedName(), e);
3056     } catch (DeserializationException e) {
3057       server.abort("Exception parsing unassigned node for region=" + hri.getEncodedName(), e);
3058     }
3059 
3060     ServerName addressFromZK = rt != null? rt.getServerName():  null;
3061     if (addressFromZK != null) {
3062       // if we get something from ZK, we will use the data
3063       boolean matchZK = addressFromZK.equals(serverName);
3064       LOG.debug("Checking region=" + hri.getRegionNameAsString() + ", zk server=" + addressFromZK +
3065         " current=" + serverName + ", matches=" + matchZK);
3066       return matchZK;
3067     }
3068 
3069     ServerName addressFromAM = regionStates.getRegionServerOfRegion(hri);
3070     boolean matchAM = (addressFromAM != null &&
3071       addressFromAM.equals(serverName));
3072     LOG.debug("based on AM, current region=" + hri.getRegionNameAsString() +
3073       " is on server=" + (addressFromAM != null ? addressFromAM : "null") +
3074       " server being checked: " + serverName);
3075 
3076     return matchAM;
3077   }

3079   /**
3080    * Process shutdown server removing any assignments.
3081    * @param sn Server that went down.
3082    * @return list of regions in transition on this server
3083    */
3084   public List<HRegionInfo> processServerShutdown(final ServerName sn) {
3085     // Clean out any existing assignment plans for this server
3086     synchronized (this.regionPlans) {
3087       for (Iterator <Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan>> i =
3088           this.regionPlans.entrySet().iterator(); i.hasNext();) {
3089         Map.Entry<String, RegionPlan> e = i.next();
3090         ServerName otherSn = e.getValue().getDestination();
3091         // The name will be null if the region is planned for a random assign.
3092         if (otherSn != null && otherSn.equals(sn)) {
3093           // Use iterator's remove else we'll get CME
3094           i.remove();
3095         }
3096       }
3097     }
3098     List<HRegionInfo> regions = regionStates.serverOffline(watcher, sn);
3099     for (Iterator<HRegionInfo> it = regions.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
3100       HRegionInfo hri = it.next();
3101       String encodedName = hri.getEncodedName();
3102 
3103       // We need a lock on the region as we could update it
3104       Lock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedName);
3105       try {
3106         RegionState regionState =
3107           regionStates.getRegionTransitionState(encodedName);
3108         if (regionState == null
3109             || (regionState.getServerName() != null && !regionState.isOnServer(sn))
3110             || !(regionState.isFailedClose() || regionState.isOffline()
3111               || regionState.isPendingOpenOrOpening())) {
3112           LOG.info("Skip " + regionState + " since it is not opening/failed_close"
3113             + " on the dead server any more: " + sn);
3114           it.remove();
3115         } else {
3116           try {
3117             // Delete the ZNode if exists
3118             ZKAssign.deleteNodeFailSilent(watcher, hri);
3119           } catch (KeeperException ke) {
3120             server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception deleting node " + hri, ke);
3121           }
3122           if (zkTable.isDisablingOrDisabledTable(hri.getTable())) {
3123             regionStates.regionOffline(hri);
3124             it.remove();
3125             continue;
3126           }
3127           // Mark the region offline and assign it again by SSH
3128           regionStates.updateRegionState(hri, State.OFFLINE);
3129         }
3130       } finally {
3131         lock.unlock();
3132       }
3133     }
3134     return regions;
3135   }

3137   /**
3138    * @param plan Plan to execute.
3139    */
3140   public void balance(final RegionPlan plan) {
3141     HRegionInfo hri = plan.getRegionInfo();
3142     TableName tableName = hri.getTable();
3143     if (zkTable.isDisablingOrDisabledTable(tableName)) {
3144       LOG.info("Ignored moving region of disabling/disabled table "
3145         + tableName);
3146       return;
3147     }
3148 
3149     // Move the region only if it's assigned
3150     String encodedName = hri.getEncodedName();
3151     ReentrantLock lock = locker.acquireLock(encodedName);
3152     try {
3153       if (!regionStates.isRegionOnline(hri)) {
3154         RegionState state = regionStates.getRegionState(encodedName);
3155         LOG.info("Ignored moving region not assigned: " + hri + ", "
3156           + (state == null ? "not in region states" : state));
3157         return;
3158       }
3159       synchronized (this.regionPlans) {
3160         this.regionPlans.put(plan.getRegionName(), plan);
3161       }
3162       unassign(hri, false, plan.getDestination());
3163     } finally {
3164       lock.unlock();
3165     }
3166   }

3199   /**
3200    * Set region as OFFLINED up in zookeeper asynchronously.
3201    * @param state
3202    * @return True if we succeeded, false otherwise (State was incorrect or failed
3203    * updating zk).
3204    */
3205   private boolean asyncSetOfflineInZooKeeper(final RegionState state,
3206       final AsyncCallback.StringCallback cb, final ServerName destination) {
3207     if (!state.isClosed() && !state.isOffline()) {
3208       this.server.abort("Unexpected state trying to OFFLINE; " + state,
3209         new IllegalStateException());
3210       return false;
3211     }
3212     regionStates.updateRegionState(state.getRegion(), State.OFFLINE);
3213     try {
3214       ZKAssign.asyncCreateNodeOffline(watcher, state.getRegion(),
3215         destination, cb, state);
3216     } catch (KeeperException e) {
3217       if (e instanceof NodeExistsException) {
3218         LOG.warn("Node for " + state.getRegion() + " already exists");
3219       } else {
3220         server.abort("Unexpected ZK exception creating/setting node OFFLINE", e);
3221       }
3222       return false;
3223     }
3224     return true;

3258   /**
3259    * A helper to handle region merging transition event.
3260    * It transitions merging regions to MERGING state.
3261    */
3262   private boolean handleRegionMerging(final RegionTransition rt, final String encodedName,
3263       final String prettyPrintedRegionName, final ServerName sn) {
3264     if (!serverManager.isServerOnline(sn)) {
3265       LOG.warn("Dropped merging! ServerName=" + sn + " unknown.");
3266       return false;
3267     }
3268     byte [] payloadOfMerging = rt.getPayload();
3269     List<HRegionInfo> mergingRegions;
3270     try {
3271       mergingRegions = HRegionInfo.parseDelimitedFrom(
3272         payloadOfMerging, 0, payloadOfMerging.length);
3273     } catch (IOException e) {
3274       LOG.error("Dropped merging! Failed reading "  + rt.getEventType()
3275         + " payload for " + prettyPrintedRegionName);
3276       return false;
3277     }
3278     assert mergingRegions.size() == 3;
3279     HRegionInfo p = mergingRegions.get(0);
3280     HRegionInfo hri_a = mergingRegions.get(1);
3281     HRegionInfo hri_b = mergingRegions.get(2);
3282 
3283     RegionState rs_p = regionStates.getRegionState(p);
3284     RegionState rs_a = regionStates.getRegionState(hri_a);
3285     RegionState rs_b = regionStates.getRegionState(hri_b);
3286 
3287     if (!((rs_a == null || rs_a.isOpenOrMergingOnServer(sn))
3288         && (rs_b == null || rs_b.isOpenOrMergingOnServer(sn))
3289         && (rs_p == null || rs_p.isOpenOrMergingNewOnServer(sn)))) {
3290       LOG.warn("Dropped merging! Not in state good for MERGING; rs_p="
3291         + rs_p + ", rs_a=" + rs_a + ", rs_b=" + rs_b);
3292       return false;
3293     }
3294 
3295     EventType et = rt.getEventType();
3296     if (et == EventType.RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE) {
3297       try {
3298         if (RegionMergeTransaction.transitionMergingNode(watcher, p,
3299             hri_a, hri_b, sn, -1, EventType.RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_MERGE,
3300             EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING) == -1) {
3301           byte[] data = ZKAssign.getData(watcher, encodedName);
3302           EventType currentType = null;
3303           if (data != null) {
3304             RegionTransition newRt = RegionTransition.parseFrom(data);
3305             currentType = newRt.getEventType();
3306           }
3307           if (currentType == null || (currentType != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED
3308               && currentType != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGING)) {
3309             LOG.warn("Failed to transition pending_merge node "
3310               + encodedName + " to merging, it's now " + currentType);
3311             return false;
3312           }
3313         }
3314       } catch (Exception e) {
3315         LOG.warn("Failed to transition pending_merge node "
3316           + encodedName + " to merging", e);
3317         return false;
3318       }
3319     }
3320 
3321     synchronized (regionStates) {
3322       regionStates.updateRegionState(hri_a, State.MERGING);
3323       regionStates.updateRegionState(hri_b, State.MERGING);
3324       regionStates.updateRegionState(p, State.MERGING_NEW, sn);
3325 
3326       if (et != EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED) {
3327         regionStates.regionOffline(p, State.MERGING_NEW);
3328         this.mergingRegions.put(encodedName,
3329           new PairOfSameType<HRegionInfo>(hri_a, hri_b));
3330       } else {
3331         this.mergingRegions.remove(encodedName);
3332         regionOffline(hri_a, State.MERGED);
3333         regionOffline(hri_b, State.MERGED);
3334         regionOnline(p, sn);
3335       }
3336     }
3337 
3338     if (et == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED) {
3339       LOG.debug("Handling MERGED event for " + encodedName + "; deleting node");
3340       // Remove region from ZK
3341       try {
3342         boolean successful = false;
3343         while (!successful) {
3344           // It's possible that the RS tickles in between the reading of the
3345           // znode and the deleting, so it's safe to retry.
3346           successful = ZKAssign.deleteNode(watcher, encodedName,
3347             EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_MERGED, sn);
3348         }
3349       } catch (KeeperException e) {
3350         if (e instanceof NoNodeException) {
3351           String znodePath = ZKUtil.joinZNode(watcher.splitLogZNode, encodedName);
3352           LOG.debug("The znode " + znodePath + " does not exist.  May be deleted already.");
3353         } else {
3354           server.abort("Error deleting MERGED node " + encodedName, e);
3355         }
3356       }
3357       LOG.info("Handled MERGED event; merged=" + p.getRegionNameAsString()
3358         + ", region_a=" + hri_a.getRegionNameAsString() + ", region_b="
3359         + hri_b.getRegionNameAsString() + ", on " + sn);
3360 
3361       // User could disable the table before master knows the new region.
3362       if (zkTable.isDisablingOrDisabledTable(p.getTable())) {
3363         unassign(p);
3364       }
3365     }
3366     return true;
3367   }

3400         + rs_p + ", rs_a=" + rs_a + ", rs_b=" + rs_b);

3421             hri_a, hri_b, sn, -1, EventType.RS_ZK_REQUEST_REGION_SPLIT,
3422             EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_SPLITTING) == -1) {
3423           byte[] data = ZKAssign.getData(watcher, encodedName);

3432               + encodedName + " to splitting, it's now " + currentType);
3433             return false;
3434           }
3435         }
3436       } catch (Exception e) {
3437         LOG.warn("Failed to transition pending_split node "
3438           + encodedName + " to splitting", e);
3439         return false;
3440       }
3441     }

3443     synchronized (regionStates) {

3446       regionStates.regionOffline(hri_a, State.SPLITTING_NEW);
